I left with- the unfinished Thai sauce in the takeout pack- and a note to self to return for another satisfactory (and satiating) experience.

I generally won't write hotel reviews but every now and then I make an exception. This is one of these genuinely better experiences. I particularly like the warm, welcoming atmosphere, the friendly, attentive staff. The comfortable room and quality restaurant only add to that.
Review Text

My Organization had a wonderful experience at the Southern Sun, Ikoyi where we hosted an event.  From the inception, to the event and the after sales service was superb. We truly appreciate the hotel's superb staff, Madam Ubong Nseobot, Mariam Akporu and their excellent team for the hospitality and care in handling our event.  We hope to maintain this excellent service for our future engagements.

I had a very nice stay here at Southern sun ikoyi. Staff were great, service with a smile. Led by Sam and service by Fisayo at the restaurant. Clean rooms. The gym is superb with instructor doing a good job

Great hotel, pleasant and clean with courteous and respectful staff. I recommend this hotel to all. I stayed here from the 6th - 8th of May, 2021 and was really impressed by the decency of the hotel and all the staff that attended to my needs. They were professional and caring. Well done guys. Please keep this up.....

I honestly do not know where to begin but the service myself, my parents, friends and wedding guests received was surely one to remember for good. You guys truly make hospitality look easy (mind you it's a luxury in these parts). Thankyou because my wedding day was super colorful and peaceful and you guys added to that. From the gate to the concierge, reception, restaurant/bar. All spot on. Una do well.

Thank you Cliff and staff. Feels like coming home when we visit your hotel. Sorry we missed Mark but the service and food outstanding. Room spotless and so comfortable. We will be back Love Ian and Debbie Wickham

Beautiful ambiance and consistent good service for years. Loved the chicken sandwich and pineapple fresh juice infused with ginger meeting rooms are so neat and big.  Lovely renovated rooms as well. A must visit!

Review Title: Hospitality at its peak. Great stay
Review Text: The hotel is easily accessible, environs very clean and all COVID protocols observed both in the common areas and in the room. Very warm staff. A big thanks to Mr Chukwudi who made my stay very comfortable. He checked during breakfast and after work to ensure everything was ok. Great stuff, please keep it up and I will definitely be visiting again.

Review Title: A Fine Example of True Hospitality
Review Text: Without doubt one of the best hotels I stayed during my almost 3 weeks in Lagos  Location of the hotel was great and close to some lovely restaurants. Rooms were comfortable, clean and adequately functional for work. Thanks to Mercy, Samuel, Tomi and Mr Suleman in dining, Daniel in housekeeping and Boniface at front desk for the service excellence! And the other staff were very  friendly, helpful and efficient too.  Excellent standard all round, keep it up!

First stay at SS. Birthday weekend for my sister with all the family. Polite staff at check-in (despite payment hiccup due to network issues); v attentive staff at breakfast (on Day 2 they remembered my parents wanted lemon/ginger/honey without them having to ask and thanks to Kayode for promptly offering hot puff-puff ). Impressed about COVID-19 protocols at breakfast buffet as we were paranoid about having to touch general cutlery. Kudos to the hands-on F&B manager who doubled as a host and waiter (he also sent me back to wear my mask before entry). Our rooms were nice and clean. The a/c was very effective (excellent for Lagos). However, when we asked for extra duvets, housekeeping said there weren‚Äôt any but provided extra sheets as a sub. The only negative was the discolored

A great 3 days at the Southern Sun Ikoyi. Clean rooms, great service with attentive and courteous staff, superfast wifi, supersport tv channels, bar area with good ambience and a selection of anthing one could possibly want. Breakfast buffet and meals all very high quality. Nice clean swimming pool. Looking forward to my next visit. Highly recommended.  T. B.
Review Text

I came with my family on two back to back weekends that was how much rest and fun we had! the welcome as we arrived was as always first class. my children, we excited to receive this welcome drinks too! the rooms have been upgraded and revamped it was quite stellar. the buffet so yummy with a variety of options! the indoor dining was always delicious even for my very picky children who said as we left mummy the food has been the best I have ever had!  The children enjoyed swimming and the adults had delightfully cold beverages as we enjoyed the cool breeze. the service staff so good with the COVID19 protocols I did not see anyone without a mask and had to rely on their name tags.  we will definitely be going back, with the service, food and location I can only say staying there

Their meal is wowww,i had to crush my bones to pieces, hahaha.it's not difficult to locate the hotel.i will definitely visit this place when next i visit Lagos which ofcourse will be very soon. Southern sun hotel is a place to be.

We came here to rest and allow the strain of a hectic weekend to wear off. The room was cosy with a firm bed and clean soft pillows. The buffet breakfast was great! The hotel had courteous and friendly staff too.

The last time I visited with my family was with a baby and asides the very tasty meal, Hospitality was so commendable.  Coming back during the pandemic with a very active toddler, I had concerns. I was so impressed by how safety conscious the hotel was and the measures put in place, the staff were so warm and welcoming, the hospitality was heightened from my last experience and we had such a memorable time.   My family and I enjoyed every meal but as my personal favourite, I'll suggest you never skip the pepper soups at meal time. It's always a win üòâ

Review Title: A Lovely Buffet Delivered By Southern Sun
Review Text: I want to thank Southern Sun Ikoyi, Lagos, for the wonderful service they rendered on my wife's birthday. Due to the coronavirus crisis we had to order-in a buffet from them and they surprisingly performed exceedingly well. The food was lovely and superb, they were flexible and also helped with the choosing of the menu, even delivered bespoke food that was not on their menu at my request. Excellent service from Southern Sun Deputy General Manager himself Mr Cliff Shiridzinodya, Food and Bev Manager Mr Sam Muiruri and Executive Sou Chef Sossou. Thank you so much!

Review Title: SUNDAY BRUNCH AT SOUTHERN SUN IKOYI
Review Text: Today was another of my many visits to the Southern Sun Ikoyi. I went for their Sunday Brunch and as usual it was top notch. The food was excellent with a wide variety of continental and local delicacies to choose from. The staff were courteous and friendly and the ambience warm and friendly. An overall pleasant experience that I would definitely repeat quite often!

The hospitality of Southern Sun never goes out of taste. Even in this pandemic, it is still top notch with strict compliance to safety rules to protect both guest and staff. Excellent service!  Buffet service so organised to meet with with COVID 19 safety rules, as the guests pick and the chef serve without guest cluster or handling of serving utensils. And there Portioned food items particularly the Portioned honey, is awesome

Staying Period 11 November till 14 November.  Dear Mark and Team, thank you so much for the amazing accommodation and personal attention to detail during my time of staying in your hotel. From the front door, front desk and rest of the staff, I felt compassion and authentic friendliness.  I will surely recommend the Southern Sun Ikoyi to friends and family.  Mark, I will be reading - Thank you.  May God Bless you and remember the best is yet to come.  Kind regards Serildeen Cruywagen

The reception was good and very welcoming, mostly the portals were very accommodating. The food, especially the breakfast was well prepared and properly presented. Very Good room, only the air conditioner that cannot swing and the TV remote control cannot work from a distance. However, the general performance of all sector of the hotel was very good

Just spent the week at the Southern Sun for business. Couldn't have been a friendlier, more supportive and attentive team of people working out there. They all seemed to get on with each other, which makes a big difference. Good facilities, tasteful rooms and immediate service across all the different areas.

My room was comfortable, there were a variety of pillows - very soft, soft and not so soft, so I had a choice of pillow to use. The food is good (a mix of cultures presented as buffet at all meal times).  The swimming pool water was warm and nice but  the pool bottom is not illuminated and there is neither changing room nor restroom by the pool

Review Title: My Stay in Southern Sun Ikoyi
Review Text: It was a wonderful experience that I'm looking forward to having again.  I encourage the management to keep up the good work, and constantly make an upward review, in order to maintain the great standard.

Review Title: MY IMPRESSION OF SOUTHERN SUN IKOYI
Review Text: Very neat neat facility on a good Location blessed with very courteous Staff. The breakfast i full of variety,suitable enough for different cultures.I always look froward to the buffet dinner for its varieties..

Overall I had a good experience at this hotel, with one caveat: the AC in the room is very noisy and my room was near an outside generator which was also very noisy. The room was also a little small. The downstairs lobby areas are varied and comfortable and the breakfast and evening buffets are absolutely fantastic. The service is good for Nigeria, although reception staff could be surly at times. Getting onto Wifi was complicated and erratice and in the end I gave up.

I was here for a writers festival in October 2019. All of the staff members were very welcoming and helpful. They made it easy for us to get settled in and, each day, get to the festival venue a few blocks down. The food was great and with so many writers talking and drinking well into the night, it was wonderful to see how welcome we were and how attentive staff remained. When they ran out of irons and ironing boards, I had to send a dress to the laundry for ironing late in the evening and worried that it would not be done the next morning. I was very happy to get it on time and perfectly pressed! The hotel was very clean. Some of the rooms could use a little refreshing, but overall I was pleased with my stay and how we were received,

Fairly average Nigerian hotel experience. The rooms were too pricey for the quality therein. One staff was rude to the point other guests were staring. I tried to correct him and he argued back even ruder. The breakfast wasn't that great either, with a limited selection for a "buffet" with that price point! Come on! But the awesome chefs who make omelettes are always nice, always helpful! Southern Sun Ikoyi, you need to retrain your front desk/reception people.

We enjoyed our stay overall and would highly recommend it for your stay as it is on of the best hotels in Lagos.  Pros: -Friendly, helpful staff  -Rooms are clean  -Well stocked mini bar  -Strong shower  -Delicious buffet food -Quick room service  -The room was a good size  -Some nice extras like complementary wine on the first night   Cons:  -Being signed out of the WiFi every few minutes  -Noisy air con  -Limited entertainment channels  -Restaurant staff could be quicker  -The meal portions are excessive if you order A la carte which results in a gross amount of food wastage  -At times the room/bathroom had a smell we couldn‚Äôt quite place   Never the less as previously stated, you will enjoy your stay here and have the comforts one would desire on holiday.
Review Text

A return to Southern Sun. Great as expected. Wonderful breakfast! Courteous staff. Hotel management needs to encorce front of hotel is drop off only, ensuring vehicles parked in the abundant car park slots. I will be back.

The room was amazing. I had a wonderful view, and the staff were super nice and friendly. The restaurant was one of my favorite places. The food was spectacular. I really enjoyed getting my omelets in the mornings, made by the nicest guys I‚Äôve ever met. I‚Äôll definitely recommend and come back!

My wife and I arrived at the hotel late Friday afternoon and well received at the entrance and immediately attended to by very cheerful Reception Staff and whisked up to our room on the 9th floor without any fuss. The room was really beautiful which, we were later advised by the General Manager, (Mark) had recently been upgraded as had all rooms in the Hotel. The room furnishings were top-class with a collection of Nigerian artwork and books of interest. In the evening we had cocktails in the popular Main Bar, on the ground floor before dining on the Terrace outside next to the pool - a great setting which is adjacent to the Main Dining room where we enjoyed a lazy, late breakfast in the morning. Sunday Brunch at the Southern Sun Ikoyi is a well known, 'not to be missed'

Good to see quality, value for money and fantastic service still exist.....well done......the food was great, the security was in place and the service from all departments, IE, Room service, reception and business centre staff all excellent

My husband and I have been staying here from Australia for the past week for our 27th wedding anniversary. It's a clean, safe, lovely hotel with very pleasant staff. We have a great view of the beautiful sunrise from our room, which has well appointed furniture. The buffets are excellent. The front desk is very helpful, and the laundry service is really good. The doorman is friendly. The small pool is especially refreshing after a session in the gym. It's quite central and well known, so whenever you book an uber, it's easy to locate your position. It's relatively close to the national museum, galleries and the Muson Centre and other local artsy attractions in Onikan and Victoria Island.

Southern Sun hotel is easily accessible and located in a beautiful part of Ikoyi,Lagos.   Exquisite rooms with a bed to die for and lovely shower and bathrooms . I loved the buffet breakfast and the warm reception.   It is quite perfect for a stay in, outdoor evening sit out or a dinner hangout. Quite a professional place to visit

I had a really great week at the Southern Sun Hotel. The best part was that the food was really plentiful with many options for vegetarians and vegans. I appreciated the service as well. Also, if you're into trying out some tennis, one of their staff members, Paul Silas is a tennis pro and gave me a really amazing lesson for an hour! So take advantage if you can of this rare opportunity.

Review Title: Always a great location and hotel. The food is superlative and inviting. Gracefully tge hotel appreciated my customary p
Review Text: and enlisted me for reward for which I enjoyed a momentary credit. The warmth of reception arises from my familiarity with the environment. That's has created an empathetic relationship with your staff. Nothing beats the expectational value in this deja vu.

A decent place very centralised and totally professional well recommended. My wife thoroughly enjoyed herself. The hotel is also very assessable to wheelchair users. The breakfast and dinner buffet where also on point

Nice rooms, well cleaned. Breakfast variety wide but food mostly tasteless. Bar service good and barmen courteous. Check-in and check-out fast and efficient. Adequate parking space for cars. Swimming pool quite small and would have expected something bigger for a hotel of this size.
Review Text

Special thanks to a particular staff at the restaurant Samuel Muiruri who professionally worked with me to remotely plan my husband‚Äôs surprise birthday celebration. They tried their very best to accommodate my requests and helped make the day as special as it could be. The array of food displayed was fantastic and we were pleasantly pleased. I will definitely recommend the Southern Sun Sunday brunch for intimate special occasions. Definitely worth it!

I came by one afternoon to attend a business meeting with my colleague. The hotel has great service. The food served at lunch was wonderful. The staff at the hotel were extremely friendly and very courteous.  Highly recommend!

I forgot my MacBook  and other person effects and after months I was traced and it was returned to me. I want to specially thank the front office department and particularly Mr Paul Silas for trying to get a hold of me while in the US and my family in Nigeria has my items now. You guys are the best, and I  will definitely return to stay there.

The hotel was on very good location and very net. I will differentiate visit again and recommend as well. I will suggest you work on the rooms. The rooms need to be real modernize. Apart from that everything is perfect

Warm reception at my arrival and departure. Courteous and friendly staff. Variety of options for breakfast. Neat room, comfortable bed. Good lounge area for a business meeting. Well maintained property.

I have been here 3times and it only gets better. The renovated rooms are just wonderful, Ambiance on point. The best of it is the food. A very pleasant kitchen staff-Mercy put together for me sea food okro. When she did this, they did not have this already prepared seafood okro but she promised and delivered. Thank you Mercy!!!

Shout out to the chef and the courteous F&B Manager, Mr. Sam  Southern sun has the best grilled chicken one can have The jollof as tasty as a well made home food, very tasty. The service is lit. Looking forward to their chicken atete again.  Southern sun is a home away from home

The hotel is located at central location. The tariff is reasonable to that vicinity and the services are efficient. The response and courtesy is good. I would like to visit that property again soon .. i have been staying in that property during my visits to Lagos since i see overall it is good. Over the days of stay, the staff understands the needs and taste and come up with those without asking ... so sweet

Review Title: Southern Sun Ikoyi, Lagos, Nigeria- Truley a home away from home.
Review Text: I have been a long stay guest at Southern Sun Ikoyi since the beginning of this year. As a businessman I found the hotel as a perfect fit. The buffet menu has been expanded, don‚Äôt know if the chefs took new cooking classes but the meals were sweeter and richer in taste. It was an hiatus I was happy to be out from, definitely resuming my frequency and even business meetings here.  Oh! the price was unbelievably affordable, with kids paying half price. My entire family felt like kids in a candy store when we saw the array of food display.  But it might be best to call and make a reservation, unless you don‚Äôt mind a wait time as low as 5 minutes to as high as 30 minutes for a table.  Thank you southern sun ikoyi for keeping the Tsogo sun flag flying high.

Our recent visit to the Southern Sun Hotel Ikoyi was simply fantastic. Quality personal service Perfect pristine rooms. Excellent dinner and breakfast. Professional and friendly. Will definitely recommend this hotel which I rate among the best in Lagos. Rgds Ian and Debbie Wickham.

Overall experience was great, Hotel staff very helpful and friendly. Always willing to help and go the extra mile to achieve customer satisfaction. Hotel Manager was present at times but never greeted while present. I was not satisfied with the WIFI, as the signal was not reliable within the room, downstairs it was better, but fluctuated.

I thoroughly enjoyed this hotel. The staff who checked me in on arrival were courteous and friendly, ands included Marcus, Juventus and the team on duty the day of my initial arrival. It was a fantastic few days of stay.

Review Title: My go to hotel in Lagos
Review Text: Have stayed at the Sun over 20 times and it is very consistent. Comfortable rooms with working Air con. Quick check in, good breakfast, & a very good gym are the stand out pluses for me. If you are in town for business around the VI area then the hotel is perfectly located.

I attended an event that was held at the pool at the hotel. I was one of the few event members to order food from the menu. The waiter moved in slow motion and had no sense of urgency. Even when it was time for me to pay my tab, I had to go into the restaurant myself, to initiate payment at the internal bar cash register.

Review Title: Value for Money and Enjoyable Comfortable Hotel
Review Text: Great place to stay when on Business in Lagos.  All staff are extremely professional and helpful and security and safety is at their forefront.  Rooms are comfortable along with the bar & lobby area.  Bar can be quite lively during the latter part of the week and a good place to meet and catch up with colleagues.

Nice place to stay...Friendly staff..Cute rooms with clean bathroom. Had slight issues with the chef but was resolved professionally by the manager on duty. I would recommend anyone to stay in this hotel.

From the moment I pulled up it was an enjoyable stay. The room was spacious and clean and the bed was very comfortable. The food was delicious, I had room service and breakfast. The bar is nice and the service very good. I will be returning

We have just had the pleasure of staying 2 nights at Southern Sun Ikoyi , and highly recommend it. The hotel and all of it's facilities are amazing, with nice views from Windows It was spotlessly clean, both inside and out.  The swimming pool is cool and inviting. Our room was spacious, and attention to detail was superb. All of the staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly, they assisted us with any query we had, and we were greeted constantly with huge smiles.  The breakfast and dinner was varied and delicious.

Nice and welcoming Hotel. Nice and helpful staff. Clean room and environment. Nice food with fine Restaurant.   Recommended for any one with a taste for excellent service in the heart of the best of Lagos Island.  But on the high side of cost

My employer booked me a dayroom while in transit through Lagos. Security was efficient. Checkin staff were friendly and efficient. The room was spacious and comfortable although some furnishings and fittings shows signs of wear and tear. Good wifi connection all through the hotel. I had lunch at the restaurant and the food is freshly prepared from the a la carte menu. I had the chicken curry with basmati rice and it was delicious. The pool area is nice with the option of enjoying your meal el fresco. Although it does not share the same views as the Radisson it is in better shape than the Eko. Worth a stay if you are looking for something else

The location, facility and services offered were just as expected for the purpose albeit slightly pricey. However I suppose the hotel could use some upgrade to things like the old bed which wasn't all too comfortable while the idea of insisting full payment upon check-in looks embarrassing to the guest. I'd normally expect this to be done during check-out.

Review Title: Safe but the facility is begging for renovation
Review Text: The hotel‚Äôs restaurant is still the best. I had a beautiful shower experience which I usually look forward too. Please the hotel need to be renovated and that should be done soonest as the excuses for the delay is no longer acceptable.

Review Title: Clean, Comfortable and Enjoyable in this chaotic city
Review Text: What a pleasant experience in whatbis know as a crazy and chaotic city. From the gate to the staff that service your room, you are confronted with good values, kind hospitality and friendly service. Service is also exceptional. Would recommend d for anyone traveling on business.

Room dining is very good. Room may require an ungrade. Room rates were increased. Notwithstanding the issues, it is still my choice of hotel when on Lagos Island.

Hotel is clean and tidy and rooms are well maintained. Also, considering you are right next to a main road they are nice and quiet which was good.   Restaurant food was delicious (would highly recommend the Jollof - was so good!)  Staff were friendly. Our experience was good an stay relaxing. We needed an hotel in a secure location with good facilities, food and ambience, all of which Southern Sun Ikoyi provided. Main drawback was lack of fresh croissants at breakfast.

Thank you to the staff and management at Southern Sun Ikoyi  for hosting the best Sunday brunch, we thoroughly enjoyed our Sunday and the service and the buffet  spread was of the highest standard. I highly recommend their brunch perfect way to end your week.

Review Title: A Fantastic Weekend Beach House Package at Southern Sun Ikoyi
Review Text: I stayed at Southern Sun Ikoyi this weekend and got to experience services by the hotel which were new to me. It was  well beyond the excellent food we have come to associate Southern Sun Ikoyi with. This special weekend package included a boat trip via Fiki Marina to a prestigious beach house at ilashe. The boat cruise and time spent at the beach house were exceptional. On Sunday morning, the weekend treat was topped up with a special visit to Oasis spa (a couple of blocks from the hotel) for an amazing full body massage. Absolutely wonderful. I had no idea a weekend in the Lagos I live in daily could be even more fun. It was a brilliant weekend and Southern Sun Staff were the perfect host. I strongly recommend you inquire at the welcome desk about the SSI weekend Beach House

My stay at the hotel was a remarkable one.  Exemplary level of African hospitality. The staff, the food , the ambience name it ; made my stay enjoyable and memorable .   I would recommend the hotel any time to anyone who would love to have a similar experience.   Keep it up ...

Old hotel and needs refurbishment. The food was good but service desk staff not very nice.  I forget an item in the room I was in and upon calling to make arrangements to collect it I was told that there was nothing left in the room. Yet, I did forget it there.

Stay was fine. Housekeeping, dining was very okay. The staff were also courteous and efficient. Neat environment also. I think they can add more of social activities. The gym and spa were also up to standard.

Having had several breakfast meeting in Lagos we decided this time to try the Southern Sun. Service was ok , not the best in Lagos, but was ok, coffee was good the food was varied and well cooked. I will return again for another meeting, just need the staff to be slightly more attentive, no one likes waiting 10 minutes for coffee.

This was my first visit. I did not find the entrance to be very impressive and not a lot of space for business meetings.  The service in the hotel and friendliness was of a high standard. The rooms are fairly warm. Many chips and marks on furniture. The water was hot and the beds very comfortable. It is what you would expect from a 3 star hotel. I did have dinner at the hotel (line fish) and it was excellent.

Stayed for 3 nts on a recent business trip to Lagos. Very secure building and surroundings with an impressive Reception area. Staff very reliable and friendly. The only critical point is the poor state of the carpet in the rooms.
Review Text

So hubby and I visited the Hotel for their Sunday brunch . Ambiance was on point, food spread was good. The steak was really yummy and I enjoyed the peppersoup as well. The waiters were on point and very respectful. They kept the juice and wine coming, I had to beg them to stop. My only con was the dessert, the cakes were not as yummy as I expected. I would recommend the brunch though if you are not too keen on dessert and it's a place where you can easily run into famous people. :) . It's a little pricey so I guess I won't be able to visit every Sunday but will definitely visit again.

Review Title: My experince in Southern Sun Hotel Ikoyi, Lagos Nigeria.
Review Text: I enjoyed my stay with my wife and two little kids. the experience was amazing which will last a lifetime in our memory and we are looking forward to having another weekend getaway at SS whenever the opportunity present itself.

Review Title: Where the Sun Rises and Sets Late for Continues Experience
Review Text: My experience at Southern Sun was wonderful  and lovely from the gate to the warm welcome cocktail drink coupled with the assistance given to me by the receptionist. The services of the waiter and waitress were mind blowing. I felt like not leaving the hotel on the day of departure because I woke up late and was wishing the experiencing will continue. So I say Southern Sun Ikoyi is where the sun rises and sets late for continues experience!!!

I have been at Southern Sun Ikoyi several times and they never disappoint!Excellent customer service, staff who are always welcoming from the moment you step into the hotel to the moment you check out,excellent service at the restaurant with a variety of food;hands on managers-Mr.Samuel and Mr.Francis. I have also noticed that the power outages are very few(happened once)as compared to before.Keep up the good work and thank you very much!!!

The hotel reception is quite a busy place yet the staffs were all working hard to keep the guest comfortable. The room i stayed in was quite cozy, the lights, the bed, the shower,..it was all a a wonderful experience. i would suggest you get your credit cards loaded because you will sure get a run for your money.

I had an exquisite stay. The ambiance was very welcoming. The employees very courteous. My room was comfortable and clean. I enjoyed my dinning experience. Overall I had a really enjoyable stay at Southern Sun Ikoyi

Excellent hotel in very good location for business and leisure. Breakfast which is included in the price offers a variety of cooked English, Continental and African breakfast. Rooms are really comfortable and the rain shower in the bathroom is superb. Rates with most four/five star hotels I have stayed in round Europe and Africa.

First and foremost the pictures don't do this hotel any justice!! The pictures are old and outdated. Before I go to any hotel I alway use TripAdvisor for my final decision. I first judge by the pictures but was confused why it was $200+ a night and the rooms look old and over used. So I tried my luck and just booked for a night and to see what it looks likes. When you arrive you're quickly greeted by hostess. They take your bag and try to check u in as smoothly as possible. I got in about 8pm so I wanted to have dinner downstairs and I asked the hostess what are the choices. She politely told me either buffet style or I can pick from the menu. Well since in my next life I'm fat, of course I picked the buffet (haha) food was AMAZING. And I finished everything lol. So after dinner

Review Title: It is good I gave them a 2nd chance
Review Text: When I arrived there 1st time there was 10 pm and power shortage. Elevators worked (own power generators) but nothing else including reception (and PCs there). It was disaster. Receptionist asked me (and other guests) to wait until we have electricity. I received a bottle of water but after 45 min I started thinking ‚Äì what will happen if electricity is back in the morning? I had to leave the hotel at 4:00 am due to early domestic flight so I had literally max. 5 hours. Eventually a receptionist woke me up at the reception chair and told me I can go to my room and once electricity is back they will give me a key-card (it didn‚Äôt work as it couldn‚Äôt be setup electronically due to lack of electricity). After 30 min in my room I heard some noise outside. It was air-con generators

My go to hotel in Lagos. I have been staying here for 8 years. Customer service is exceptional. The food is good. Everything works as it should in a business hotel without stress... fantastic staff especially the welcome staff. Look out for Edward who is also an exceptional tennis coach, but everyone is great! Great hotel.
Review Text

Thank you for this beautiful stay at your hotel. I appreciated the calm, the cleanliness, the quality of the meals, the welcome of the staff, The gym and the free sports coach. ... thank you for everything

Review Title: World Class service in the hart of West Africa
Review Text: I had the pleasant opportunity to spend a week in the Southern Sun Ikoyi hotel which, I have to admit, was the choice of our company local staff. My business trip in West Africa is not over yet and after a short trip outside Lagos I am looking forward to return to the same hotel (Southern Sun Ikoyi) which provided for the whole last week an outstanding service. Starting with the warm, friendly and professional attitude of all employee - without exception and finishing with the high quality cuisine at the hotel's restaurant which offers numerous options for breakfast and a great variety of delicious European and local dishes for the rest of the day.
Author Location: Pointe Noire, Republic of the Congo

Review Text: We visited the hotel on a short holiday and several things stood out for me.. I have visited big hotel chains, like the raddison, intercontinental etc but there is one thing Southern Sun beats them all at... Excellent Customer service. This Is probably the first hotel where the Food and Beverage Manager gives all guests personalized attention..congratulations Samuel,I noticed the General Manager always on the floor ensuring service is smooth...(we had to ask who was that man checking around if guests were happy). One hostess, Yetunde always had a warm smile to welcome us to the restaurant..Otobong the bar man always got our mimosa right...Paul the waiter, excellent service... I'm definitely visiting again soon....the food variety was awesome. I miss the multi cereal croissants

The internet service should be improved upon, most nights, the internet signal goes to sleep, and requesting technical assistance at that time of the night makes you feel inhumane. However, the hotel services is standard.

Excellent service delivery, courteous staff, clean and serene environment, Superb security. the conference hall was well arranged and the facilities are adequate for the retreat.. The management of the hotel was friendly and response to request was timely and well attended to.

Everything was so perfect that i dont have anything to complaint about. Its a perfect hotel to stay or even to spend your time in the Lobby. Awesome food and staff. its in a very safe area so personally t think walking around wouldnt be a problem for anyone.

A great place to have a nice peaceful breakfast with family right after church. Not as busy as the Sunday Brunch they have in the afternoon, so definitely a good alternative if you want a decent spread, but prefer to avoid the crowd. The staff was polite and Samuel (in the dining section) was particularly helpful in making special arrangements for a birthday surprise for my mother.

The facility is in a very good location and environment coupled with good timing for the  team building, socialization and coming together in a very long time.  We all had fun  and did not want to leave.  Looking  forward to coming back.

The rooms are very comfortable, even though its situated on a busy road, it is very quiet within the hotel. The food is excellent as always, and the staff really try and make you feel welcome, from the doorman to the front staff and management. Excellent stay.

Friendly and efficient front desk manager and Samuel at breakfast service made this a great stay for me and my infant. They were caring and responsive to my child‚Äôs needs and that over came the slight issues with cleaning staff.
Review Text

Stay at Southern Sun Ikoyi Lagos, the environment was very serene and neat and the staff are so friendly and courteous. I particularly liked the way we were welcomed into the hotel and checked into our room, i also enjoyed the GYM facilities

As usual I had a fantastic stay in Southern Sun Ikoyi. Fabulous food, courteous service and great location. A hotel that caters for families and business travelers.The only snag is that the rooms need updating.   The best hotel in Lagos!!

vibrant comfortable, clean, safe a modern hotel. The rooms are  not too spacious but are clean. Loved the buffet breakfast with all fresh fruits, juices, pastries, and rice. Its an easy and relaxed place to stay

world Standard Hotel. Can be compared to any 5 star hotel anywhere in the world.very warm ambience from the car park to the interior. The breakfast was superb....nice gym too. the bar and business lounge was very impressive too. I am indeed looking forward to return here.

I like the location of the hotel .The staff are very warm and friendly .the buffet breakfast is very good. I enjoyed the Friday evening life music and would like the time to be extended. Nice experience

I stay at Southern Sun, Ikoyi - Lagos every time I have business engagements on the Lagos Island. I usually get an upgrade and I'm extremely satisfied with every aspect of the services provided such that I always return. The breakfast is thumbs up!!!

I went to Lagos for a high profile wedding and was glad the bridegroom had booked me there at a huge discount. I wasn't sure what to expect but was pleasantly surprised about the quality of the hotel and its service. Keep it up

Well located hotel that offers an excellent stay in a busy city. My daughter described it as an oasis of calm and commented on how lovely it was to come to the hotel at the end of each day to recuperate üòÄ. Courteous and helpful staff especially the porters and the staff in the dining room. Breakfast offered an excellent choice and we experimented with combing various foods, this was fun. The dinner buffet was value for money and very welcome on the few days that we had our dinner in the hotel. I liked the wide range of seating areas dotted around for one to meet with visitors.  We stayed in an executive double room and our daughter in a standard room. Both rooms were very well presented and kept impeccably clean. The complimentary snacks and drinks provided a nice touch.

I was quite disappointed. this is my first time here. My room had a stench smell once I entered, I knew it was from the rug....at night the AC leaked throughout the night and I had to collect the water using a bowl throughout the night. I complained at the front desk and the first question I was asked was "how did you get a bowl to collect the water". The hotel is getting old with little or no repairs done. found cobwebs under the bed with some serious dirt.

The location of this hotel is just perfect. Clean and also close to a lot of business people in Nigeria. The room that i got was a bit old and worn out but for just one night it was great. Really enjoyed the dinner buffet and drinks. The manager and staff were very hospitable and the price was very good. this place worked well for me. I will stay here again if I go to Lagos.
Review Text

Only concern was on the air-conditioned that was noisy in my room. Rest of the overall stay was very good - nice room size.  I would have liked having a bath in the bathroom, but ended up not having a lot of time in my room, so it never mattered. I was surprised when I learned on the prizes of products in shop versus cost of items in the mini-bar (disappointment e.g.. 1000 N for a Mars bar )

Thanks. It took to long to deliver in room service when I ordered dinner for two, the first came after about one hour after ordering and the second game another hour after the delivery of the first. You guys May want to check the night god service. Thank you

I enjoyed my stay at the Southern Sun all of the amenities, very customer focussed and the room quality was very good, it met the standards of the Southern Sun brand that as a business traveller you would expect to receive in other Tsogo Sun hotels Africa.

It was a wonderfully pleasing experience that meets the orthodox global standards in the hotel industry. The transformed Ikoyi Hotel is a pride to every Nigerian and others who have experienced the amazing services offered by your caring and highly disciplined work force. You have gained my trust and confidence. I look forward to being in the Southern Sun whenever I am in Lagos.

My newly wedded wife and I thought the hotel would be a great place to stay as it's right next door to the venue of our wedding reception.  Our photographers took the opportunity of the well done up lobby area of the hotel to conduct an impromptu photo shoot and the hotel staff were quite accommodating about this.   And if we thought that was great, it got even better. Our room was upgraded to an executive room and we had a nice bottle of chilled bubbly waiting for us when we got back into the room after the day's celebrations. The room was quite nice and we had a good night's sleep. We also enjoyed the complimentary breakfast for two.   All in all, excellent value for money and an all round amazing experience. Would definitely recommend!

Travelling for business can always be quite daunting but it is made easier by the warm welcoming smiles and good service of Southern Sun Ikoyi. They are ever ready to make your stay more enjoyable and have a great level of care and concern around your comfort. Its a great place to stay.

The service was efficient, friendly and courteous and the food was really tasty. I made use of the gym which is very good. The only snag was the internet which was sometimes a bit erratic otherwise I would have given them a 4 star rating.

Review Title: Rooms and service are not up to international standards
Review Text: Things look positive upon arrival...nice new lobby area and funky bar area.  However the desk staff looked less than enthused and barely spoke to us during check-in and just handed us our keys without a word...not a great start.  We were given a welcome juice drink, served in a dirty glass...  Things get worse when you go to the rooms:  - corridors and lift areas smell musty  - rooms and particularly the bathroom are tiny - rooms need a major refurbishment  - aircon is very loud and ineffective  - no plugs near the bed...ludicrous, and the other three-point plugs didn't charge a phone for some reason  - my bedspread was actually dirty, with brown dusty streaks  - my plug socket was installed upside down (room 707) - no iron or ironing board (a norm for business travellers) -

Had a brilliant stay here for 4 days - staff was always friendly and willing to help with anything. Clean, comfortable, with a great view from the top floors. Highly recommended in a city that can be so overwhelming!

I enjoyed their breakfast buffet at the hotel with lot of variety to select from. The hotel is neat despite the age meaning the Engineering team and Hotel management are doing a good work. The room was comfortable and relaxing, good housekeeping staff. In all, I enjoyed my stay. Still one of the best in Lagos.

Within the 'chaos' of Lagos, this has been a little oasis of delight. The staff are all friendly, and nothing seems to be too much for them.  Having had the best cup of green tea in over 2 months of travelling, excellent local dishes being offered at the buffet to try as well as a varied main menu, this has been a delight. When something doesn't meet expectations, the team do all that they can to resolve, and after 24 hours many key staff seem to recognise my colleagues and me, and take an interest in our day.

Loved the people, the food (especially breakfast!!!) and the location. There was a bit of a mixup with the room type so be sure to reiterate specifics such as Two Beds if sharing... all in all. No complaints here!

I like the ambience of the hotel, but the mini bar seems like a booby trap, you are not warned that you will be exorbitantly charged for the water inside the fridge. and it becomes more ridiculous taking cognizance of the amount you pay for the room.

Lobby is impressive. Rooms are medium sized, toilets almost new. A/C too noisy. Breakfast is gorgeous, as well as buffet-dinner. Staff is friendly and available. Other facilities which I didn't use. No luxury, but really comfortable, with an extraordinary ratio quality/price.

I had a great time at Southern Sun hotel Ikoyi, the view from my room was really nice, Food was fantastic, service was awesome. I will definitely recommend your hotel to friends and family....Thanks to the team at Southern Sun you guys rock!!!

Very clean rooms and delicious meals but too expensive. The staff are very courteous and welcoming. Not only that i was satisfied, I also believe that I received a valuable service for my money, and I also feel valued and respected by the workers providing the service.

I often travel to Lagos and always stay at this hotel. The staff are really great and always make you feel welcome. Good Gym and pool Food is also excellent. Management always available if needed and the WiFi is excellent

Was a great time celebrating my husband's birthday at the restaurant. I simply loved every experience here. A best place to be of course, key prospects to meet for those who would want to network for business Opportunity üòÄ Every meal displayed and eaten were just awesome. Would repeat my visit over againüòòüòòüòò
Review Text

The food was good throughout the stay and the hotel had a good bar area that whilst not busy was always pleasant.   Evening buffet was as good as the breakfast and the communal areas fine. the pool seemed an afterthought and the hotel was not a place where I could see people lounging around the pool.  Bedroom was a disappointment, the ac was noisy and the carpet a bit sticky.

Southern Sun Hotel, Ikoyi is located in a nice and quiet neighborhood of Lagos. It is also close to Victoria Island as well as the third mainland bridge  They have great customer service, very clean rooms, excellent wifi, knowledgeable bar tenders, delicious, complementary, breakfast buffet. And their goat meat pepper soup is amazing

My wife and i were at Southern sun for valentines weekend. The room was very cosy and the environment serene. Service was good especially the gym amd sauna.it was a generally great experience apart from the receptionists who were luke warm in their attendance when recieving us.

Very comfortable, the food Breakfast , snacks and Dinner was very good . One of the backroom managers Jennie was excellent . Its in a good location which makes easy access to Victoria Island and most important of all the island bridge to get to the airport.

Review Title: My Stay at Southern Sun, Ikoyi, Lagos
Review Text: I stayed at this hotel for 6 days in February 2017. What stood out was that the staff was very efficient & always willing to assist, meeting all our requests in a very timely fashion. The waiters & concierge were very friendly as were the Kenyan senior staff - Financial Controller, Chef & F&B Manager. The breakfast menu was also very wide in variety and I found that I did not need to each lunch on most days due to heaviness of the breakfast meal. The hotel location was great and I found I could access most places with ease via Uber which was very reliable. The room decor was okay but I must admit I expected a lot more class given the brand name. My room had a consistent musty smell, possibly from the carpeting. I would suggest that the hotel finds a way to make the rooms more

Review Title: Good budget stay, limited but nice food spread ...
Review Text: It is centrally located hotel on island. Though I visited in 2015, wanted to put this up by saying that it is one of the very good hotels. Quite accessible and safe.  Service quality is better than so many other hotels  in city. Stayed for more than a week and was always surprised by their warmth. Infact, on my departure hotel manager gave me a small memento.  Need to mention, the way they went out of the way to make vegetarian food available.

The hotel and restaurant are excellent. Hotel staff are courteous and assure your stay is memorable and the food is superb. I highly recommend Southern Sun, Lagos. I will have spent more than two weeks on this stay and it has been great.

Hotel was safe, comfortable, no frills, but excellent staff and breakfast.  Shower was highlight of the room.  Bed could use an upgrade... furniture overall wasn't luxurious, but gets the job done (would be considered 2-3* outside of Africa most likely).  Wifi is OK, good enough for basic emails etc, not great for streaming or sending/receiving large files (good luck finding that in Lagos).

stay was excellent. customer service was great. room was clean and food was delicious. sunday brunch was very delicious but I think guest staying in the hotel should be priced half. drinks was off the hook, a little pricy compare to other restaurants.

WAS A LITTLE ABOVE AVERAGE BASE ON MY RECENT EXPERIENCE. CHECKING AND Review Of Rooms Was A Problem Because We Were Informed Its Against Your Policy To Check Room In The Night And I Wonder What‚Äôs The Difference Between Day And Night Checking Of Your Rooms Before Your Customers Can Make A Choice Of Stay.
Review Text

Southern Sun provides a wonderful ambience for relaxation. It is where elegance and efficiency meet. I recommend this hotel for anyone who is looking for comfort, elegance and efficiency in hotel accommodation. The buffet breakfast was good with array of varieties.

We got a discounted company and weekend rate so value was very-very good for the money we paid, especially comparing to other hotels in Nigeria. Definitely our preferable hotel for our next trip to Lagos.

Review Title: A great hotel and great location
Review Text: The first room had a bad odor to where I started getting a headache, this was like a strong mildew scent. I was quickly changed to another room, without any issues.  The new room's bathroom needed some work on proper cleaning...that is an easy fix.  But the remainder of my stay was pleasant.  Location is ideal...I would return to this hotel and recommend this hotel to people!

I like the food the best, especially the dinner, both the local food and the western. Hope i will bring more of my friends to taste it, i am sure, they will enjoy it. Also the breakfast is fine, fresh bread and fruits

I stayed at this hotel in May 2016 and did not hold out much hope but I was definitely "disappointed" in a good way. I am not sure whether my expectations were low but this hotel would hold its own against other 4 star or therabouts hotels.   As with most good hotels, the best thing about this hotel is the staff. They are pleasant, friendly and always willing and available to help.  The breakfast in this hotel is out of this world, I was definitely impressed by the variety of Nigerian and continental options available. I would recommend booking the bed and breakfast rate.  The rooms are clean and modern and probably have the best showers of any hotel in Nigeria.   The hotel is in an excellent location and a safe neighbourhood and I had no problems getting an Uber within a few

Great place to spend a weekend. Amazing breakfast buffet. Got the Christmas promo rate which came with free breakfast buffet for 2 and complimentary ironed shirt. Very friendly staff. Went for a night of relaxation and mission accomplished.

A very good hotel.  I enjoyed my stay.  I love the gym and sauna.  The swimming pool for me is too much in the open. The buffet is very great,  with the chocolate cake always out of this world.  The rooms are small but very neat.  Please do away with that loud AC.  Otherwise keep up the good work and look into upgrading the rooms.

Lagos is not everybodies favorite travel destination but for business this hotel is great. The hotel offers great rooms, good wifi, meeting places, great food, swimming pool and gym. The staff and management were very professional, helpful and friendly.

A weekend business stay. I can testify southern sun Ikoyi is a wonderful place for both business and leisure. My first business stay and it was an excellent affair. Room also suitable for mall meeting and conference call

Review Title: Southern sun Ikoyi customer Reviews. An excellent experience you want to remember.
Review Text: The amiable, cheerful, helpful staff is your biggest point .Food is delightful and the ambience of your environment exudes timeless elegance and cronvenienc . Your kindness makes a pleasurable experience not so easy to forget and I will definitely recommend you to anyone. Though Lagos has many hotels but yours is a home away from home. The staff exudes excellent, professional, dedication to providing extremely exemplary guest relations.
Review Text

Good food, lovely environment, rooms were neat, complimentary breakfast was a plus and the best hotel staff ever!!! they were so polite and pleasant, always ready to assist.They made our stay very enjoyable.

Lovely Place....Great Service....Warm Personnel. From the welcome from the concierge at the entrance, the graciousness of some receptionists, the smooth functioning of the elevators, the wooden decor and simplicity of the rooms, the phone etiquette of the restaurant staff, the high quality of the breakfast meals, the ok-ness of the dinners (I didn't have lunch there)-------- ''twas a pleasant experience.

Review Title: Great stay, great staff, great hotel
Review Text: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay thanks to Mark Loxley's (GM) great leadership and exceptional staff. Everything for the week was executed to perfection and I greatly appreciate that. I'm looking forward to staying with at the Southern Sun in Lagos in the near future.

The helpful friendly staff at the Southern Sun Ikoyi is their biggest asset.  I have stayed a couple of times in recent months and found the customer service to be fantastic on both visits.  The rooms and buffet breakfast are also of a good quality.  Easy access makes the Southern Sun a good choice to avoid the traffic on Victoria Island.

I visited the hotel twice for lunch and at both times I enjoyed  the services. The hotel offers nice food and beverages , the meals are continental with some Nigerian dishes.  I recommend the hotel for nice dishes for both local and foreign guests, especially for business meetings.  This hotel has good things to offer, the management just needs to explain to some staff the difference between looking and staring at guests.

I enjoyed a one week stay. the rooms are very good. Service was good and the employees are warm and welcoming.  The only thing I didn't like and maybe its because am Kenyan is the booking team insisting that I had to pay before I got a room. Otherwise everything else was ok.

The hotel is amazing, the staff are awesome. I have traveled quite a lot over the past year, I have just had the best burger in my life. I decided on room service on my 3rd night, i ordered a blue cheese and crispy bacon burger, what an awesome delicious experience, i have just had the best burger in my life. Overall all the meals are perfect, you will never be dissappointed.

The Reception was pleasant, however the room was nothing to write home about for a 4* hotel to say the least i was disappointed with Southern Sun. Review Text: Friendly service, efficient internet connectivity and all the ammenities make this an ideal hotel for the business person. Location excellent for travel in Ikoyi or Victoria Island. Security, which is important in this part of the world, is really good. Home away from home.

A restful weekend with the wife turened out to be anything but.  Air contitioner in 410 required technician's attention 3 times between 11 pm and 5 am. It is a medium sized motel type akin to Travel lodge in UK but the price of Hyatt! Adequate for business travelers but sparce for family vacations. Security is tight but friendly. Staff are on hand to help.

The hotel is very clean and comfortable. We usually wake up by 5am but found ourselves waking up at 8:30am and very well rested.  The staff are very wonderful people and they are very eager to help.  The food was delicious and they had a lot to offer.  Great place to relax and enjoy yourself.

My overall experience was good, people were helpful and nice. Internet connection was easy and speed was good. Dinner at hotel restaurant was also good. I had a good service. Check-in and check-out service was also good. The only negative is the air-condition in my room was too noisy. I could not sleep with it therefore I had to switch it off...

Review Text: A family brunch great selection of food and drink - packed as usual - must reserve. Ambiance and service all first class - everyone enjoyed - can't wait to go back again. Starts at midday and it's sensible to get there on time to ensure you can benefit from the full selection of international and national dishes- take particular note of the carvery.

This was my first trip to Nigeria and honestly I wasn't sure what to expect. As a vegetarian, knowing that I would be away from home for two weeks I was prepared to go relatively hungry but the continental breakfast buffet I saw in the morning proved me wrong. It had a lovely selection of fruit, pastries, salads, and cooked items and the option of a packed lunch for the office was ideal as I had control over my food which is important to me. Review Text

It was a short snappy visit this time around, however for the period the hotel ambience and services met my expectation. The welcome drink was wonderful, the room; tastefully furnished and confortable. The dinner was larvish, tasty, norishing and satisfactory.

5 years ago, we spent our wedding night at Southern Sun and now 5 years later the experience was seamless. A weekend at Southern Sun was a lovely getaway from the hustle and bustle of Lagos. The staff were courteous and professional in all our interactions with them.

One of the nicest hotels in lagos.Very good facilities and the food is exceptional.kudos to the chefs and workers providing the excellent service.only need to work on the carpeting and the slightly noisy room air conditioning

Review Title: Nice and cosy rooms with interesting views of the environment
Review Text: Cosy rooms, excellent service, great meals, functional wireless, and located in the heart of Ikoyi, Lagos. The gym and spa also help unwind after a tough day. Oh, and there's ample parking space too. Good place to be.

Review Title: Southern Sun - Great Place to stay
Review Text: For work reasons I spent almost 3 years back and forward between Portugal and Nigeria and I usually stayed at the Southern Sun hotel. I had a very good time,the staff is very polite and very kind to everyone. My room was always very clean and the internet was perfect.The food in the Hotel is the best that I ate in Nigeria and the bar has a big variety of drinks.  I really feel that during 3 years this hotel was my 2nd home. I definitely recommend everyone to stay in this hotel in Nigeria.

Best hotel in Lagos. Great service by the friendly staff. Very professional customer service. Awesome food and very clean rooms.  Credits to Mr. Lawal and Samuel Muiruri for the great care during my stay.

Good location with parking space. To noisy and difficult to have a meeting during the day. Buffet available through the day. Found the breakfast good however the lunch and dinner were a total let down.

Review Title: Great location but quality doesn't match
Review Text: The booking process prior to our stay was excellent - please commend Mr Michael Evuleocha. The location of the hotel is of course excellent. In room 218, there was a loud tapping noise for the first 3 out of 4 days. I think the food offering should be more varied. It is obvious that this hotel does not really cater for holiday makers as by 10am the breakfast bar was ready for closure. The breakfast bar should have been more varied, with fresh fruit and larger croissants. The guy making the omelette was overwhelmed with 2 orders. In summary, courteous staff, good location, but quality of offerings should be better.

Home away from home I will say .I feel at home any time am at southern sun Ikoyi hotel,. I will recommend this hotel for family and friends to stay .

As usual, the buffet spread was extensive and great. The food was quite enjoyable and any requests we had were handled expeditiously. We had unlimited juice and champagne with our meals as well.  My father enjoyed himself thoroughly and we'll definitely be back soon.  Thank you Southern Sun!

Ive stayed here a number of times and will keep coming back. It's well situated for Yaba and for other mainland options. Some of the rooms are a bit tired and it could do with an overhaul but the buffet and overall food &drink options are good. Nice bar and lounge.

SouthernSun is a hotel I will recommend anyday. I get that feeling of never wanting to leave. The beautiful cityview room was the icing on the cake. I really look forward to our next visit.
