We were well received by courteous customer service personnel, offered drinks and asked to sit down while they process our check-ins. The environment is generally very neat and pleasing. The breakfast was delicious.

The room AC needs to be worked upon. It was noisy and not cooling as required. The floor carpet too needs to be changed to Floor tiles for transparent cleanliness. The Toilet and bathroom facilities are very good. Room service too was very good and fast, though the prices are exorbitant.

The Breakfast was very good and there were varieties to choose from. There was incessant power failures during our stay, this should be looked into. There internet keeps logging us out and not easy to connect back as after some trials.
Review Text

Big, Charming  and Finesse. Quality service and very good for business meetings. This edifice is easy to locate on Alfred Rewane Road, very close to the Local Government Registry, Eti-Osa.  The staff are also professional and on point.

The best place to be in Lagos from midday on Sunday - for  a wonderful brunch- so much choice and a great carvery as well. Definitely the place to eat and to be seen as well because this is highly favoured by Lagotians, out of towners and overseas visitors as well. Better book and don't be late - nearly always full - and great value for money because of the fantastic selection of dishes.

Convenient hotel - wifi is working well and service is all right - room are a bit humid . Good breakfast and  good sunday buffet though the buffet in the week does not vary much. Overall a good hotel to stay for business.

Review Title: Great hotel! Clean, modern and great location
Review Text: Stayed at this hotel for a night and was pretty impressed. Its modern, clean and worth the price! The reception and lobby were tastefully decorated and the staff were incredibly polite. The room was pretty spacious and the bathroom came with a shower + tub. The only complaint with the bathroom is the toilet water was yellow when flushed - that was pretty weird!  We ordered room service which came pretty quickly although i found the snail stew too oily for my liking. The food prices are pretty expensive though so you can get more for your money by going to a neighbouring restaurant e.g Casa d'lydia which isn't too far away.  The breakfast spread was pretty extensive and we were stuffed! From pancakes to omelette to different types of sausages, bacon, fruits, multiple bread

Review Title: Excellent hotel for Lagos, though overpriced
Review Text: Southern Sun was my first place in Lagos and looking back it was a good place to start. While it has atmosphere of its European counterparts, expect less value for your money.  Accommodation was very nice and clean, all equipment functional.  Quality of restaurant varies. Breakfast is just ordinary. Their cuisine combines delicious meals accompanied with average condiments. I had simple but delicious lamb shank with just average mashed potatoes. In this price range I expect every part of the meal is sophisticated. I expect something more for my money.  Overall it was a nice experience.

Had business lunch and couldn't believe I was eating at a hotel. The food was top class both local and international. The most interesting part was having the chef walk round and discuss the meal. I found that exceptional.  Service was very good and the waiter were alert to their responsibilities and had great attention to each table.

The services offered were interesting. The rooms are beautifully adorned with good sheets, a large screened tv set, and a good reading table. The hotel is well located in the heart of Ikoyi, A highly reserved Lagos area. will  like to come back in the  future

A business hotel situated on the island. God ambiance and nice food. For short stays this is the best hotel in Lagos with easy connectivity to island and mainlad. The staff is courteous and is ready to help with last minute seminars or meetings based on availability. The buffet has a theme which changes every evening avoiding any monotony.

Above average hotel for Lagos but staff are completely careless with guest needs.  Food quality is good but service is really bad.  Cleanliness is below average.  Backup power is well below standard.  Overall not at all worth the money

We were warmly welcomed to the restaurant where the staff were polite and helpful. Breakfast had a good spread but was really warmed up by the chef on duty who made eggs to order beautifully with a touch of humor! Our waitress Yetunde was very attentive and made us feel well taken care of. Altogether a wonderful experience.
Review Text

Good premises, standard rooms, good gym that overlooks the pool, very good buffet for dinner with different live cooking every evening, but most of all, the most polite staff!! They make your day with their smile! Extremely safe. Close to the office area.

We had a great and relaxing time at Southern Sun! We enjoyed the many positives like great staff such as the delicious buffet for breakfast, lunch and dinner. They serve many choices and the foods are fresh. Desserts are fantastic. The food is probably the highlight of the positives. The room was very clean, but small.  It does seem a little outdated but still nice. The shower is outstanding! Bed is comfortable and the sheets clean. The only negatives I found was the AC had not been cleaned. We cleaned the filter ourselves and there was strong smell in the room - possibly the cleaner thy use. The hotel itself is very nicely decorated. It's small but they managed to have many amenities. Will go back. Highly recommend!

Went here for some business meetings. Great service by staff, food was excellent & pub area relaxing. Staff is very welcoming and deputy GM makes you feel at home. Thanks for the great visit, look forward to more.

Review Title: Value for money for long business trips
Review Text: This hotel can offer great value for long stays (more than 9 days). generally they offer a free evening lounge access (only for long stays) and if negotiated well, the suites are cozy and nice. they also have two meeting room that can be booked in advance. No view  from windows though (only jammed street from as early as 7am)

Stayed at the Southern Sun this last weekend, Febrary 5th - 7th for a weekend retreat. Check in was smooth. The rooms looked a bit dowdy and require renovation and modernisation but were comfortable. There is wi-fi - and it is fast. The best part of this hotel is the food! There was a small band that played Friday night with a great saxophonist. A wide variety at every meal and very tasty too. Great ambience, good food! Made up for everything else!

The hotel rooms need to be modernized especially the AC systems . No remote controls and very noisy   The carpets are worn , the water quality is poor and generally the establishment must be revamped to compete on the prices

The hotel is decent.  Not five star but it is clean.  Food is o.k., not great but there is probably something for everyone on the menu and on the daily buffet. The buffet has a lot of Nigerian dishes which seem to be popular.  The rooms are a good size, housekeeping does a good job.  The electricity goes out all of the time in Lagos but the hotel keeps everything running.   There are many things to do within the vicinity, it has a good location.  Beware of the ATM outside (fraud alert), go someplace else if you need to get out money.

Review Title: Relaxing 2 nights stay,great meals, discreet well trained staff in the heart of Ikoyi Lagos
Review Text: I just got back from this hotel about an hour ago. I live in Lagos Nigeria but had a residential retreat for stakeholders in the justice sector from Friday to Sunday (5th Feb-7th Feb). We were in a group of 30. Check in was easy and the meals dinner lunch and breakfast were the highlights of my stay. The meals well well prepared and not boring as I normally get tired of hotel food quickly.. The restaurant staff were attentive discreet and well trained..one noticed the consistency of my fresh melon n orange juice n without my complaint offered to change it.. Even the staff at the gym offered me water and towels without asking and was so helpful..I give 100 percent to management for training of the staff. The only problem I had was with the room.. The rug in the room needs to be

I was in southern sun with my two sisters for 2 nights, I enjoyed every second. It so much reminded me of Hotel Verde in Cape Town cos they have a lot in common. The service, the hospitality, the rooms are all great. I enjoyed every meal. The environment is so cool. I'll definitely go back on my next visit to lagos.

Good food, good service. Awesome experience.     No complaints.   Location is okay, rooms are clean. Staff is friendly. Wifi was good. Quite a good number of English TV channels available unlike most hotels
Review Text

Unknown to my friends and I, Southern Sun Ikoyi offers a great ambience to kick start the weekend. We had a really exciting night enjoying wine and cocktails at the bar/lounge area and had delicious bites to nibble on. My friends and I will definitely visit the hotel bar on another Friday night.

Having lunch at the Southern Sun Ikoyi is truly a refreshing experience. The food is excellent and the service is professional. The ambience is airy, friendly and quite relaxing. Overall, a fine dinning experience indeed.

Review Title: Unfriendly receptionist but peaceful and relaxed stay
Review Text: Southersun Ikoyi is a hotel that brings peace/relaxation to me whenever I visit. During my last visit, I was a bit disappointed at the reception I got from the front office  staff on duty. As front-liners in any hotel and first point of contact one will expect a better welcome. The lady on duty made me feel I was been checked into a zero rated hotel. At some point I considered leaving untill I spoke with The PR manager(Ubong) who made me feel welcome and brought back the 5 star feel of southernsun I have always known. She displays such level of professionalism I wondered if the lady on duty was really a Southernsun representative. I look forward to another visit hopefully front desk executives are better trained.

This hotel is good but  the standard of cleanliness neds to improve. I find that the cleaners are clueless and do not even know the right gadgets to use for cleaning.  They do not seem to appreciate hygiene standards.  The wetroom was very unclean and I could not bare to step into it barefoot. There should be more investment into training and supervision.

Review Title: Very good service and food, but two noise issues
Review Text: The staff were friendly and attentive, and the food was good. The pool is big enough to swim in, and  has a small area with grass and  trees.  The first room  I had was small, but adequate.  I was then moved to a larger room, with a bath.  Not very exciting, but comfortable and has a good work area.  A few other reviews have mentioned the A/c, but most people do not mention it.  If you are sensitive to noise (like me) then it is a major issue.  The a/cs are a strange design that I have not seen before.  They are individual units at low level, just one step up from the old "wall bangers".  It seemed impossible to turn the fan speed down, so they were a constant presence.  I tried switching the a/c off, but could only last so long.  Presumably the hotel was built just before the

Review Title: A perfect anniversary spot for us
Review Text: It was refreshing, tasteful and provided the much needed atmosphere of rest I and my wife looked for. We only took our breakfast at the facility but even at that it met our expectation...we had enough options for breakfast.

Review Title: A refreshing start into the new year
Review Text: Recommended a family get-away with my friend and cousin. The children had so much fun with the array of sumptuous meals on the buffet table, the teenagers enjoyed the gym, while the ladies had a relaxing time in the sauna. Of course the men had their me-time watching the EPL with chilled drinks. Sleep quality was heavenly.  Southern Sun Ikoyi is my BEST Tsogosun hotel brand and am certain its one of the best in their chains.

From the reception, we got very good welcome with a complimentary drink while booking the room. The receptionist that attended to us was gracious and courteous.  The complimentary breakfast was nice. We and the children enjoyed it. The overall experience was pleasant.

very good hotel with great staff. good and clean environment,sweet food,good location and very convenient.i will be there soon with my family and will really want to stay longer. calling on everyone to try and i am sure you will love Southern Sun Ikoyi Lagos.

This is my second time in Southern Sun Ikoyi and just like in the previous time, I had a nice stay. Good for a 4 star hotel. The Dinner was good and the better service was the in-room breakfast. It took the reception about 30 mins to prepare my order. Good business, keep it up.
Review Text

Review Title: A very good hotel but some Middle management issues
Review Text: A well known brand. I usually stay at the Southern sun when I am in South Africa and the brand lives up to its value proposition in terms of concept and delivery.  A bit more needs to be done to get middle management staff to understand that they should listen to their customers. I had to stop using the gym because customers do not have a voice.   I will not hold this against the hotel as I believe the issue is confined to the middle manager in charge of the gym.   I recommend the hotel for people traveling to Lagos especially on business.

Review Title: Over deduction from my credit card
Review Text: The hotel is fine, and the food OK. The rooms need an upgrade, The check out procedure is not good. My final bill was less than the amount rfeserved on checking in, on my credit card. I am still waiting for the refund some two weeks later..

The food at the hotel was remarkable. The suites are spacious but slightly outdated. The staff at the hotel were the highlight of our stay. They seem happy to work there & in turn go out of their way to help. From the porter to the managers.

The rooms nees air freshner,  the room was neat but an offensive smell in the room was sickening. I intend spending Xmas at the hotel, the management should work on the front office team, the check in counter team should be a bit friendly, they were not smiling.

Probably the worst dinner buffet I have eaten, or tried to eat. Tired food that looks like it was left over from the Sunday brunch. The service was good however the food was lacklustre and as a vegetarian the only choice was rice or potatoes. To be fair the lettuce I ate was ok. But I will never eat there again. It was embarrassing as I was at a business dinner.

I have been using the facility of Southern Sun Ikoyi every time am in Lagos. The hotel is well managed and its cleanliness is second to none.  The quality of service I receive every time and always made me choose Southern Sun Hotel Ikoyi above every other hotel around Lagos.

Good hotel. Nice and lovely breakfast. Nice dinner but delivery can be faster. Good ambience. Efficient checking in and out. Courteous staff. Location is good and readily accessible. In general, nice and good hotel.

Review Title: very relaxing stay at southern sun ikoyi
Review Text: Staff at the reception were very warm. since it was a business stay, they also informed me of the corporate discount for staff from my organisation. I enjoyed the breakfast and the staff was eager to render any assistance.

I am extremely pleased with the level of service I received at the Southern Sun Ikoyi during my 4 day stay. From check in to check out everything was done with the utmost courtesy and extreme politeness. A service request I put in was promptly taken care of, the food was fantastic (get the blue cheese and bacon burger) and the room was comfortable. I would definitely stay again

Generally high standard of service and facilities. Restaurant buffet has a good choice at all meals. Gym had good selection of Eq√πipment DNS a helpful in-house trainer. Bar small but adequate. Standard rooms are not very large but sufficient. Rooms are comfortable but some of the plumbing and aircon is a little tired. Good location for access around Ikoyi and VI.
Review Text

Southern Sun is truly a homely place for me. The staff from the security, concierge, reception, housekeeping, laundry, and IT are awesome. It's always nice returning back there even after a long time.

Review Title: pre wedding pictures and night out
Review Text: Enjoyed every bit of my stay and would go back if the need arises. Hotel staffs are well trained and professional. I had issues with the coolness of the air conditioner and called the reception for help. The maintenance team came in immediately to take care of the situation.

I like this hotel generally. But today the service was atrocious. Ordered food it was not delivered. Asked for a bill didn't get it no pineapple juice. Asked for an iron non available. This is horrible. No manager in sight to assist with my terrible experiences.

In my job I travel a lot and also sometimes assist other teams based outside country with some of their logistics.   Whenever I have a large team in country with me and we need to be in Lagos, Ubong is my go to person. She is accessible, friendly, and will move mountains to ensure that the hotel is able to accommodate one‚Äôs requests.   She serves with a smile that you can tell from her voice regardless of the number of changes made to a booking and last minute cancellations.   Thank you for taking all in your stride.

Review Title: Good location and really good food
Review Text: The food was excellent and I can't complain about the service. The phone in my room wasn't working which was the only bad thing I could say about the hotel. Would use it every time I come to Lagos. Had my clothes washed as well which was a bit expensive but they did a good job.

I enjoyed my stay. The room I booked, though small, but was very clean. The bathroom is inviting. I like to stay under the shower and enjoy the gushing water.  Meals are also nice and well presented.    The AC is really noisy, they should be changed.

I spent two night at the Southern Sun Ikoyi hotel on a business trip in May. Staff is professional and friendly . The location is in a quiet location. Food is tasty and good. Rooms are nothing special but clean.

The service rendered was perfect, the room was always clean, the room was beautiful including the air conditioner that makes the room so cool and comfortable,the location was in a very tidy environment and the amenities there a lot of facilities including swimming pool,the gym,lounge n so many more.what I liked most was the food recipes and no least.

Quiet, serene environment. Truly a rest haven in busy Lagos. I was a bit disappointed though that the pool closes at 6pm, I expected it to be open a little later for people in town on business and endure Lagos traffic

Southern sun hotel food taste great. Environment is conducive. Great workers and friendly people. Beautiful room. Very Neat. More space outside to walk. Swimming pool should be at the back. Thank you.
Review Text

This was my second stay at S.S. Ikoyi, and the staff was again friendly, the food very good and my room was clean. I especially enjoyed the (free) big buffet breakfasts. Lots of food items to choose from. The hotel also sports a very nice gym with sauna.

Each time I spent time at S.S. Ikoyi, I always left with a smile. It's a friendly, welcoming, comfortable with smart looking and caring staff. In all my dealings I always felt someone paid attention to my needs in a personal manner Good lounge with nice ambiance,comfortable rooms with good detail, a bar that has wide range of drinks as well good meals at the restaurant. The best is that I always get a good deal. My College Alumni has held dinner parties at Southern Sun and everyone loved it. It's currently our number one destination.

Was so confused by the buffet menu that I ended up sticking with only 20% of what was available. Though I wish I could have stomached more.  The waiters were very courteous. Basically enjoyed my stay at the hotel.

When we arrived there was a pianist in the lobby which was very stylish and a nice cocktail bar. Location is very good. Room was unremarkable but clean and relatively modern...I don't understand why West African hotels insist on garish carpeting combined with arctic (and expensive (in terms of their operating costs) air conditioning) combined with the duvets...perhaps they wish to remind business travellers of home in colder climes...concierge service was efficient when collecting my bags for check out. The front office desk was gracious regarding check out. The desk couldn't seem to cope with our delegation when checking-in and everything was frenetic, long winded etc. Absolutely ok business hotel but not my favourite in Lagos...haven't found it yet and still looking

Some off the best trained staff I have seen in West-Africa. I travel mostly in West-Africa on a weekly basis and the staff here is the best I have seen in the last 8 years. The managers should take some credit for this.

Excellent service  delivery  by all standard. Well train staffs  and professionals. Very clean  environment with good meal. I will always  use Southern Sun any  time am in town. I enjoyed  my business trip and stay. Had good Internet service. Southern  Sun best by all standard.

I had an urgent need for a getaway and didnt know what to do, so i surfed the net and found details of southern sun hotel. Called their official line and was directed to their marketing office and spoke to a very cheerful lady Ms Ubong. SHe gave me details of the hotel including amenities and i as sold. I must say i enjoyed my stay..from the rooms to the restaurant and bar and the terrace. It was truly a pleasure.

I had a weekend stay i would never forget. From the front desk to the valet everybody was courteous. Rooms were quiet, clean and comfortable. The food was great as usual and cocktails for me and my darling were made just right. I will definitely visit again

I was there with friends for lunch. The ambiance.. great.. the food.. lip smacking the staff.. friendly the service.. professional. Everything just seemed to work hand in hand to bring about excellence.    Love it

I for one, i'm a good connoisseur of ambience and it does matter to me a lot that I enjoy that wherever I choose to stay. Southern Sun exudes lovely ambience and are equally equipped with extra courteous staff that dote on you ever so often making you feel extra comfortable. From Miss Nseobot (Sales/PR Manager) to Francis (Financial Controller) and Paul (In IT I believe) and other ground staff have been nothing but exceptional in being helpful and wonderful. The buffet usually consists of a nice spread and is 'yummy'. Keep up the good work Team Southern Sun!!!
Review Text

Review Title: Very Good Service plus excellent breakfast
Review Text: The service is very good & professional - from the reception to good room layout plus excellent breakfast. Ideal stay for business travellers and visitors - centrally located in the high-brow area of Lagos - serene environment -

Easily the best food and customer service experience in Lagos. I always look forward to the next trip!!  I see well trained staff always will to be of help. Excellent business center and meeting areas Wish there was a Southern Sun in every Nigerian city I visit  Wi

I have stayed at numerous hotels in Lagos over the last 3 years and the Southern Sun Ikoyi far surpasses the rest as far as guest services is concerned. The overall experience is great and the staff are extremely well trained  From greeting you regularly to constant checks on your well being, including several checks during breakfast to ensure your coffee cup and juice are topped up. The rooms are adequate for the business traveller, and most importantly for me, their WiFi is consistent and works well.  Breakfast choices are excellent with a well presented selection of fresh fruits every morning. My only complaint is that the AC‚Äôs are dated and definitely need upgrading and if you have a lower room overlooking the entrance it can get noisy with the car park announcements.

I have been staying at the Southern Sun over the past 5 years for my business trips to Lagos. I have found the team on the ground to be exceptionally helpful, from the the concierge, John, reception, dining area  Lawal, Marian, Cliff, these are a few of the people I can remember. The hotel has the best breakfast/brunch offering for me as I tried a few hotels before settling on this one. I will recommend this hotel for My friends and family for their trips into the region.

I totally recommend this hotel, standard is ok, food good and tasty, every day you can find different dish in buffet. Hotel staff is very nice and helpful, reception personnel welcome me with warm words, and with full of competences, non stop ready to help.  Room was nice, not to small and clean.

Review Title: MY STAY AT THE SOUTHERN SUN,IKOYI
Review Text: This hotel is very nice and blessed with fantastic members of staff who are ever ready to help you out at all times.  I also liked the fact that the front office manager (Jennifer Meke) was very pleasant, helpful and detailed, little wonder why the other front office desk staff were too. It‚Äôs a very good place for both business and leisure stay. What I enjoyed most? Oh I love the food and the settings!!!

I would like to congratulate the hotel Management and staff of the Southern Sun IKOYI. I have stayed in a few Hotels in my life and very seldom I have met people that is so friendly and hospitable to the customer‚Äôs .The service at the Hotel is of a very high stander. The food regardless if you eat from the menu of the buffet is of a very high stander. This will be the place I would like the people must acknowledges when they plan a trip to Lagos Nigeria.

Generally the hotel service is nice and i must commend the management of southern sun. Reception personnel that welcome me at point of arrival were warm. However, areas still need to tight up is anti-virus on wifi, too many pop up that could affect your system. Also, some basic toiletries shouldn't be asked for, like tooth paste, and shoe cleaner.

The stay at the hotel was overall good . The rooms were clean and tidy . The only thing is the decor of the hotel needs to be upgraded and to be bright and not dull . Location of the hotel is good for the business communiity . The hotels menu should included Asian /Oriental dishes as many Asian business people are comming to Nigeria for buisness .

I was there on a business trip for two days and i loved my experience. The food was very nice, i loved that the manager was always in the restaurant to check if all was OK. The staff were all good and willing to help. The internet connection was perfect. I will definitely go back when in Lagos.
Review Text

The hotel staff are very professional and the room well cleaned. Breakfast was good and the entire experience was worth relishing. The location of the hotel is also good with its nearness to the business hub of lagos.

Southern Sun is a well positioned hotel with a great team who provide excellent service. It's easy to go to mainland Lagos or to Victoria Island.  The staff is very well trained and polite and made my stay a very pleasant one especially as it was a long trip . Truly good value for money .

my A/C in the room has been blowing still and stuffy air which caused my stay a very unpleasant one. Have ask the hotel technical to resolve but problem still persists. Else overall stay is average...

Three nights in Lagos and not a single complaint. I suppose that actually deserves 5 stars...   The room was good, breakfasts did what they said on the box and there is a decent gym and swimming pool. I'll definitely stay there again.

Nice place to stay with super friendly staff. Food is good and healthy which is rare in Nigeria.  Great for business.  Rooms are sizeable and decent value for money. Great room service and room is always cleaned properly

This is my third stay in the past 10 months. I like breakfast choices. Sleeping comfort is very good. I used Gym facility and it was good. Definitely I will recommend. Not very great for Vegetarians though.  I like the gesture by hotels General Manager. They sent a complimentary Hennesey for the weekend :).

Review Title: Oasis of pace and luxury in horrid Lagos
Review Text: Nice, clean and well-kept hotel in Lagos' prime location. Friendly people, good security. Bathrooms very small but water very hot at good pressure. No international TV channels such as BBC, CNN or TV5 Food relatively monotonous, breakfast excellent, cozy bar.

Southern sun has the best buffet for any restaurant in Lagos!  Pretty small rooms and staff that renind you of the typical workers that expect to be tipped for doing nothing.  Overall, was a good stay. Check in was smooth and so was check out. Stress free

Friendly courteous staff and helpful. The food was great, catering for African to international dishes. Not a good idea to use carpets in rooms due to high humidity and associated problems. Very clean linen etc. the a Wifi was of high speed and quality allowing the connection of up to 3 terminals.

While i only stayed one night at the hotel it is a great hotel for business purposes. The rooms are good and the breakfast spread was vast and very good. The only negative I experienced was checking out was extremely slow and when you are in a rusj to get the day off to a good start this is annoying
Review Text

Most comforting beddings ever. I don't like lodging here since the sleep is always so soothing and the color makes it even more comforting. Or maybe am just speaking for myself.  Each time, I oversleep while at this hotel. I do love me some comforting, soft duvet and some soothing pillow.

Extremely friendly staff. Welcoming. The guy who plays the piano is a pro. Really good music in the lounge. Food selection is quite large. Both international and local dishes for b/fast lunch and the supper buffet. Rooms are adequate. Not as big but I was alone so no complaints. Internet is wonky sometimes.

I love southern sun,the location is perfect and easy to get to,the staff are well mannered,courteous,and respectful,always eager to help.The room is amazing,spacious with a view of the city.The food i love,love,love and always looking forward to breakfast.

The location is very good and the services impressive. Staff were very friendly and courteousness , the went out of their way to assist. Meal were nutritious and tasty . The environment clean and well maintained. The facilities were functional . I have no hesitation in recommending your hotel to who ever need a good place to stay while in Lagos . Well done and keep,on maintaining the standard.

For a frequent traveler like me, I do always cherish restaurant service higher above any other Hotel services.  This is found to be great & homely at Southern Sun Ikoyi - Home way from home. Excellent Restaurant Service.

I went there for a mi business mi private trip and apart from the first receptionist I met the first day, everything else was superbe.  Good meal, luxury, personnel very welcoming. I received that warm welcoming letter from the manager and a candy was offered to me everyday put in a different place every time and it became a game to try to figure where it was when I was getting back. Variety of food. I enjoyed the music in the corridors or the piano in the afternoon but I would have enjoyed more if there was a possibility to suggest some melodies or to do a live song session. A place where citizens of all type of colors and culture come. The IT Manager is a superman and it will be good if the management adds full function for SKYPE in the mail room.  So I will advise it to

I must say food is really really good and tasty. Hotel staff actually understand the needs of their  customers. Chefs are making food of all kind according to customers needs and hunger. I love the hospitality they treated their customer like a mom to her kids. I love to be here again and again. Cheers guys !!!!

Review Title: Everytime back home to Southern Sun Ikoyi Hotel
Review Text: This phantastic hotel is a must when you travel to Lagos. For me there is no other way at present even to stay in a well secured place and enjoy also the service of the nice hotel team. I have to thank keeping me happy all day long during my stay.

It wasn't as bad as my colleagues said it would be. I had a very pleasurable stay at SS. Besides the Generator noises outside the rooms and the stuffiness caused by the wet carpet in my room, I liked it.

Hotel is ok and Staff are courteous and friendly. The morning complimentary buffet have different varieties and also tasty. The rooms are average and neat. I Will recommend to other intending travelers.
Review Text

You need to pick a hotel depending upon location due to traffic. I need to stay in this area and used to stay at the Eko but no more.  Southern Sun is far better.  Smaller but has great food, comfortable rooms with great big shower (rainhead and hand held nozzle), A/C blows super cold if you want and excellent fast wifi which is free.  Best of all the rooms are soundproof, never hear anything next door or in the halls.  Staff very friendly and most helpful.  The gym is well equipped and there is a personal trainer to push you just enough.  There is a pool but it is small and I have not seen anybody in it.  Nice to have dinner out by the pool if you want or just drinks after long meetings.  Just outstanding!

I stayed at the Southern Sun Ikoyi while attending a business conference in Lagos. After muscling our way through the chaotic traffic from the airport to Victoria Island, all I wanted was a good night's sleep. I had lost my appetite in the traffic. However, at checking, the receptionist noticing I was dead tired offered to have my bags taken to my room and I instead go to the restaurant and have a meal. The chefs had prepared something special, she told me. And off I ventured inside. There were a host of traditional dishes that had been prepared. The aroma was inviting and I was in. The food was delicious, but very spicy, they like it that way in Nigeria. And when it was time for bed, my room was large, clean and very quiet. I had a good night's sleep because the bed was also

This very nice hotel shines out of Lagos.  Great buffet (maybe after 2 days you tried out everything but still good) and very nice gym.  Let's say great for 4/5 days  Business of course. Going back to the city might be an adventure.  For those who never visited Lagos for sure it will be a nice surprise.  Staff is friendly and after all great spot to start anything on Lagos.

I've stayed here a few times over the last five years and when it opened it was a refreshing alternative to the sleazy overpriced Eko. There are quite a few alternatives now and the Southern Sun is looking a bit tired. The buffet is good however and there's a reasonable ambiance to the place. The rooms are quite small however, and, as I said it's all in need to a revamp

I always enjoy staying at the Southern Sun Ikoyi. The staff are great, rooms are OK and the food is excellent. However, I was extremely disappointed this time round. The last night before my departure, the restaurant for hotel guest literally turned into a fish market.  Airtel had a staff meeting at the Southern Sun Ikoyi and the Airtel staff dinner was served in the small restaurant that was meant for hotel guest.  There was chaos and noise all the time. My colleagues and I eventually decided to go to our own rooms and order room service dinner, at three (3) times the cost. This is definitely pathetic. I only hope that management finds another way of catering for non-hotel guest meals.

Review Title: Better than I was expecting but very expensive
Review Text: After reading other European travellers reviews on this hotel I was inclined to think that the number of 5 star  reviews from Nigerians may have been misleading. I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived as this was a modern, nicely decorated and clean hotel. I was staying on the top floor in room 917 and this was a clean and very spacious room with tv, safe and a well stocked minibar. The air conditioning wasn't very effective and was rather noisy and there was a door to an adjoining room which wasn't locked on my side so I had to block it with the desk. These were my only complaints though. Prices are very high compared to the UK but this seems to be quite typical for Lagos. If I have to work there again then I'd have no problem going back to the Southern Sun hotel.

I spent 3 nights in this place. Nice lobby, good buffet and friendly staff at the bar but some rooms are equipped with first generation AC with engine in the room humming like an old steam boat. Then sleeping here is not that easy despite good bed. I will recommend this hotel if you can avoid the steam boat style AC.

Nice hotel, with good service and a comfortable room. It was a relaxing place to come back too after spending the day in the City. Restaurant was excellent with a mix of local and international cuisine.

Have had a couple of business meetings at the hotel and the service so far has been great and very professional.  This you hardly get in this part of the world.  The hotel has good read network, easy access with good security.

I visited the hotel's restaurant and bar for the first time on a Friday evening with my friends. It was a great hang out session and the staff were extremely friendly. I was very pleased with the cocktail and the food was surprisingly tasty. All in all, it was a very relaxing experience and we intend to make the hotel out secret weekend hang out spot. Tunji.A
Review Text

In a city like Lagos where exceptional service is hard to come by, Southern Sun Ikoyi stands out of the crowd. It's courteous and friendly staff give you a home away from home feeling.  Especially impressive are the breakfast and dinner buffets. The chef has nailed it both in presentation and preparation.

Room smells terribly after pesticides, AC is so loud that you need earplugs. Don't want to touch the floor with my bare feet as the carpet seems to be Stone Age old and filthy. Even the gym is equipped with carpet. They charge you upfront for your entire stay - but I want to get out of here as soon as possible. Avoid if you have options.

I recently hung out at the hotel bar with my friends after work on a Friday evening. It was a great start to our weekend. The finger foods were excellent and we had an enjoyable time with the cocktails and the Margarita was quite on point.

I recently had a friend lodge at the hotel and as always it was a pleasurable time. From the courtesies right from the gate, to the reception and just everywhere. I couldn't but again acknowledge the hotels' exceptional culture and service.     The room and time spent was truly relaxing and fulfilling especially at the restaurant then at the bar with other friends.   Not much to say other than ...keep up the GOOD WORK.

Really nice hotel, customer service is usually very responsive and efficient. Room is always good and clean. Nice breakfast, never tried their dinner though been that i use them when i have to work overnight in ikoyi. All in all, great value for money.

I stayed for 5 days at Southern Sun Ikoyi in April 2015 and I just loved it.  Although the check in process took some time, I fell in love with my room as soon as I saw it. It was quite spacious and the colour combination gives a cosy atmosphere to the room. The room was clean and equipped with kettle, tv and mini fridge. I really like the complimentary speculoos biscuits as well. The bathroom was also large and clean and well lit.  The wifi is good with decent connection speed. The connection doesn‚Äôt drop and it was better than I expected.  Breakfast is excellent, with so so much to choose from. Not sure what else one could possibly ask for.  Room service was also good and they would accommodate my requests at no additional charge, which was very pleasant.   There is also a

Was an enjoyable stay, excellent facilities, bar area, gym and restaurant .Staff very helpful and friendly, service great. I defiantly recommend for a business stay over.General manager friendly and very accommodating . Well run Hotel.Food excellent. Hotel has a good vibe

Running a hotel in Lagos is not easy.  The Southern Sun reminds me on how hotels were in South Africa 20 years ago.  Service is good, but check in and out proces felt cumbersome.  The rooms felt worn and smelled of sewage as did the elevators.  Breakfast and buffet dinenr I would rate as average.  Overall the hotel is over-priced for what you get - but then again running an hotel in Lagos is probably tough ...

Review Title: 1 st time a service up to international standards.....However when you arrive the 2nd time ... it is to freinds
Review Text: I have now stayed in this establishment several times ....  the service is impeccability polite, prompt ,friendly and discreet. on arrival somehow the system had "flagged" me as a returning guest. A bottle of Cognac along with some nibbles was neatly arranged upon the desk - which seem to be standard in all rooms. i have used and abused the service of this establishment .late night demands for chocolate or laundry and ironing (to be delivered before my 6 am wake up call). Such requests were always met with a hight of professionalism that would put a great deal of higher graded establishments to shame .. The breakfast is diverse .. catering for not only western and African tastes but having consideration for middle eastern clients. personally i ""abused" the smoked salmon and

Having spent 10 days in the hotel we saw the good and the bad. Good: food is largely western and usually very fresh. At times meals arrived without some of the ingredients: e.g. No fattoush on meditteranean plate. No plantains with Naija fish. Wines are overwhelmingly mediocre South African. There is far better on the market. Prices in the hotel are odd. A virgin fruit cocktail costs more than wine! Prices tend to be on the higher side. Staff are very friendly but not always very 'together' . If it isn't in the rule book they battle. Very little conceptual thinking. Rooms are bog standard Southern Sun but functional. We experienced water issues on 2 days. An apology letter is nice but really! Power via generator is good as is wifi. Do not ask the Concierge about restaurants-

Review Title: Good but can do much better
Review Text: It was my home during a week long business trip. Check in was quick with an warm welcome, rooms are spacious and nice, good food (though room service menu is quite limited).. But the major problem was the AC. I just couldn't sleep for the first 2 nights as the AC was not working and it took them 3 complaints and a little more push to get my room changed. The ACs are put in a peculiar place and are old. So even if they work, the room takes unusually long to cool down yet the bed remains warm. I'm sure the hotel would want to look into it.

Expensive for what was delivered. Not bad quality but some inconsistency for the price charged. Service at dinner and quality of cooked food could improve. Al a carte very expensive so stick to buffet which is much better value.

Attended a seminar here and I liked the ambience, so I'd always had it in mind to come and spend some quality time with my wife. Turned out my instincts about the place were spot-on; we stayed just one night on her birthday and had a great time. Excellent service all-round without having to break the bank!

This hotel is ideally located in the quite part of Lagos (Victoria Island), though it is far away from where most commercial activities take place in city of Lagos. The staff of the hotel are warm and kind, with full smiles on their faces. Breakfast here is the best, plenty choice meals to savour in the buffet service. Security is OK. the hotel is clean and constantly cleaned.  And finally, price is a bit high compared with EU hotels of same standards.

I organized an event at the Southern Sun in March 2014 for a high caliber company. I was positively impressed by the flexibility and attention of all staff of this hotel. They all contributed to make the event run very smoothly and keep the participants happy! The quality of the food at the restaurant is high compared to other places I have been to in Lagos. I would recommend this hotel if you wish to run an event in Lagos.

I like this restaurant and the spread for the buffet I think is up there with any of the other big hotel breakfast buffets. Staff are courteous and efficient too. I wish they'll stop hanging around and watching you while you eat with clipboard and paper in hand making notes of what you eat etc. Theres a lot of choice of Nigerian cuisine the food tastes really lovely.

Review Title: A wow experence at Southern Sun Ikoyi
Review Text: i was actualy well treated when i lodged at sunthern sun with a team of well trained staff who has the welfare of there customer's at heart.  I was actually amazed on the cordination and team spirit displayed by the staff

Been twice, for dinner and for massive brunch.Ambience! Affable, attentive staff! Their Chapman cocktail, a must have! Sunday brunch which local Nigerian flavours, delish! Yaay to Chef Alex Mwaura!Wow

The Southern Sun Ikoyi, is an excellent and convenient venue for business travelers to Lagos, Nigeria. The service is excellent and it's great value for money. The staff are welcoming and really know how to treat and attend to their customers.

This hotel is really aimed at the business traveller. The staff are friendly and efficient. The food is good and imaginative with both local and western flavours available.  The beds are particularly comfortable.  The traffic is noisy on the main road side and gors all night. They could be more generous with bottled water as you need to drink a lot to stay hydrated.  Lagos hotels in general are insanely expensive and this hotel is on the affordable side. This is my 4th visit.  Tip: do not book a standard room. They are surrounded by the aircon ducts and units and very noisy.
Review Text

It was a very pleasant surprise to experience first class service in all departments when i recently stayed at the above hotel. Firstly, i felt very secure due to excellent security, the service from the front desk unlike other Lagos hotels and the quality of the food and rooms was way above expectation....well done to the Southern Sun team....

Review Title: A Night in the SUN!!! Amazing.
Review Text: I simply love this hotel. It‚Äôs luxurious, stylish and the staff welcoming and attentive. Our room was bright and spacious with tasteful d√©cor and a beautifully designed marble bathroom. Everything about our stay was flawless. I highly recommend this hotel and it certainly deserves the 5 stars. Thank you for such a pleasant stay.

It was a beautiful experience for myself and my boo. We when to southern sun to lodge for 3 nights and it was one of the most romantic experiences ever. From the food, to the spacious rooms, i must also commend their excellent customer service. In one word, it is was amazing...i will like to visit again soon...

Review Title: Great hotel for a weekend, a nice brunch or a drink
Review Text: The Southern Sun hotel in Ikoyi is a little oasis of good food and good service in Ikoyi,  They have a nice spacious dining area that serves up great food throughout the week.  We love the Sunday brunch buffet which brings out the top crust of Lagos society.  The gym is very nicely equipped and clean with new machines, free weights and treadmills and the lobby bar is a nice convenient place to meet friends for drinks after work. The management team of the hotel is very hands on and always looking to make the experience of their customers as pleasant as possible.  Lagos is known for its astronomical rates for hotel rooms and given that, Southern Sun is fairly priced.

Friday evening seafood buffet with a scrumptious selection of foods, whilst entertained with melodious Jazz tunes by keyboardist, saxophonist and often old world jazz vocalist.  Lovely venue for a romantic dinner or to entertain international guests.

Review Title: A good weekend stay in lagos
Review Text: I visited the Southern Sun Ikoyi for a weekend stay with my husband. It was my first visit to the hotel and wasnt quite sure what to expect. The staff were very polite and their buffet meal is delicious. I however was disappointed with the size of the room. I will visit again but only if I have a short or overnight stay.   O. Momodu

The service, hospitality, room and vicinity/location of the hotel is very convinient. The food and wifi services were perfect. Very good outlook except for the gymnasium which has very worn out towels and some are torn

I am satisfied with the service.  I look forward to another trip again. I enjoyed the food, the atmosphere, the environment for the meeting, the attitude. I enjoyed the attention paid to all at every floor i get to.

My stay at the hotel was during my friend's wedding. I had traveled into town and asked about for a place to stay and a friend recommended Southern sun  Ikoyi. I was glad with the proximity to the wedding venue as the hotel is situated on a major road. The food was really good and most of all the environment was quiet. I really enjoyed my stay as it was a peaceful one. I hope to visit again some day soon.

The hotel is terrific as is the staff.  I recently coordinated a meeting of 30 people coming in from across Nigeria and the United States. Everything about our experience was excellent.  Highly recommend for business or personal travel.
Review Text

Review Title: Excellent Services for business and leisure
Review Text: I stayed at the Southern Sun ikoyi hotel in November 2014 and must confess the hotel's services matched the recommendation I got to stay there. The cozy environment, courteous staff and delicious meals made me enjoy every minute of my stay there. Kudos to the management of the hotel

I was privileged to use this property in January 2015 and i was really amazed, seeing the level of professionalism and principle of value for money. The management of this Hotel ensures that services were provided to my satisfaction. They were ready to go extra mile to ensure that my stay is memorable and that for every money i spent i got more that the value of it.

For three days of meetings, my company booked us a room in the Southern Sun Ikoyi. Main reason is that it's close to our office and traffic in Lagos is a serious problem. It was my second stay at a Southern Sun (first was in 2011, Dar es Salaam). And this hotel was nothing like Dar. The room was crampy, the bathroom even more. Biggest (and big is an understatement) issue was the A/C unit in the room. It was from the last century and it made more noise then my motorbike. But worst was, the amount of cold air was minimal. So, I had to make the choice of sleeping in a very noisy room, or a very hot room. I choose the last. Worse to find out, I could not open the windows. Which resulted in a hot room with a headache in the morning.  Also light problems in the bathroom bothered me.

I've spent 3 nights during a business trip to Lagos in this hotel. I can definitely say this hotel meet the european expectation when compared to similar class hotel in other countries. If I'll come back to Lagos I'd definitely come here again.

Review Title: Great hotel, wonderful food and friendly staff
Review Text: I stayed here for ten days in January 2015 during a workshop. We had many special requests, like a dinner reception, needing a private room to meet with some people, sudden audio/visual needs, etc. and each time the staff provided excellent service with a smile. All staff were very professional and pleasant. The Internet has a log-in system which was a little inefficient (it logs you off at random times), so I hope they can improve that in the future.

Enjoyed my stay at SS. The facilities were comfortable and well-maintained. I was surprised at their pool though... really tiny- but they are in an area of limited real estate so it is forgivable. Besides it's more of a business type hotel. Their breakfast buffet was really good and so were the other meals I sampled. There are a number of lounges for those who need peace and quiet to read or do some work. I recommend it if you are on business in the VI/Ikoyi area or if you just need to run away from manic lagos once in a while.

Review Title: Excellent stay over the Christmas holholiday
Review Text: I enjoyed my stay over the Christmas holidays with my girls. I'm used to hotels in the UK because I stay in London and southern sun met all my expectations. The PR executive Ubong went over and beyond to make our stay marvellous. Kudos to her. I'll stay in this hotel again when I'm in Lagos. My girls love the food and the room, the loved the buffet style meals because of the variety. I fell in love with the ambience.

Review Title: We liked it - would come again
Review Text: My husband and I stayed at southern sun for 2 nights a few days after Christmas and it was everything we hoped it would be. The food was so good with decent variety of choices and the mini bar was not overly priced. All personnel were extremely friendly especially the Sales/PR Manager - Ms Ubong who was very helpful. Loved the ambience too. Strongly recommended.

Staying at Southern Sun has always been a pleasant experience. I ensure that when I am in Lagos, it is my first choice when it comes to a pleasant atmosphere where I can take meetings and enjoy lagos.

I stayed at the Southern Sun with Hubby for 2 nights over the Christmas holiday. I was really looking forward to it, because I had heard a lot of great things about the hotel and had dined there frequently.  I was surprised when we arrived that the security check at the entrance did not include checking under the car with a hand-held mirror (like some other top hotels in Lagos do).  We got to the hotel in the wee hours of the morning and check-in was not as fast as I would have liked, considering that Hubby had booked online already. We were informed that the room he had selected was a small room and that we would be given a bigger room. However when we got to the room, we found it to be miniscule, which left us wondering what the 'smaller room' looked like. Thankfully, the air
Review Text

My family and I spent one night at the Southern Sun Lagos for the holidays and we loved it! I was a bit weary after reading about the size of the rooms but I was pleasantly surprised when we got there. The rooms are standard sized and definitely at least 1.5x the size of a London hotel room. The bathrooms in the two rooms we booked were shower but very clean and big enough for us. The hotel staff were amazing, always smiling and very courteous. Breakfast was sumptuous and relatively cheap considering the value we got. They allowed late check out by 1pm at no cost to us.  The internet wifi was free, fast and reliable. DSTV, the cable TV had several channels to chose from and catered to our varied tastes. Only con for me was the swimming pool which had no shallow end for toddlers

Review Title: Safe, courteous and value for money
Review Text: I enjoyed my stay at the Sun. They have one of the better Buffets you will get in Lagos. Desserts are mostly baked items and you might not find Ice Cream on the menu Rooms are smaller than some hotels of this size and the AC has been placed in a weird way. Beds and sheets are of good quality and you will sleep well Internet is free and pretty decent for this area. Power outages are a norm in Lagos, so you will get it where ever you go. The staff is very efficient and courteous. Food over all is good. And they have 24 HR room service The Business center allows you to print the boarding pass for FREE.  Hotel is next to the business heart of the city not the Airport so be prepared for long traffic halts :)

Review Title: Tiny rooms, service good and bad
Review Text: You really don't get a sense of how small these rooms are from many of the reviews - they are strikingly small. The bathroom is mostly shower - the rest of it needs a sliding door (regular door wouldn't fit) and its the width of the bathroom sink. The bed takes up most of the bedroom, barely giving you enough room to walk on the sides of it.   Its clean and modern, and outrageously expensive as per Lagos norms. I had a couple of problems with the room on the first day - the toilet wouldn't stop running and the A/C, despite making a lot of noise in a small room couldn't really cool it off. First time around they switched off the toilet without fixing it, and they didn't fix the A/C. Second time around they fixed the toilet and made the A/C marginally better.  However, the huge

Review Title: Great service, but very average rooms
Review Text: This is probably the best hotel in Lagos. Heavy security at the entrance. Great food and service. The rooms are however soso only. Quite small, old and a noisy air conditioning system. TV with a very limited choice of channels. Frequent power cut, so they have to switch to their own generator system. Better to avoid rooms located near the generator

The strengths of this Hotel are its very attentive staff and good quality restaurant, which is reasonably priced (by Lagos standards).  Security is very visible inside the Hotel, but it did concern me that the gate guard did not use a mirror to check under cars as they entered the compound. Room wi-fi service is good, far more dependable than the room phone, which was virtually useless.  The operator actually used her own cell phone to make a local call when I was unable to make it on the room phone.  There were at least a dozen power outages during my two-day stay, most of them brief, but one of them lasting long enough to make me opt for stairs over elevator.  Given the choices in Lagos, though, I would still stay here again.

I really enjoyed my stay in the hotel. I can't say I had one complaint about it. The room was comfortable and a very nice size. The breakfast was good I would definitely consider staying again and would recommend to anyone.

This is one of our stops in Lagos, the rooms are a bit small, airconditioners old but working. Service good and food good. Power outages a bit of a hazzle but that is something you experience every were in Lagos due to Nepa. Wifi good.

Every time I get to Lagos I use this very nice and quiet hotel on Ikoyi Island. The team is very good trained and makes you a very happy stay. The restaurant offers national and international food to meet requirements of all guests chosing this nice hotel. Will be back very soon.

Review Title: Southern Sun Hotel stole my money
Review Text: I checked in here for a Business Meeting in Lagos and stayed some nights. Everything was smooth, so generally it is a recommendable Hotel.  However at checkout they found out I was overcharged with about 35,000 Naira. Since a year the refund never took place. Even after several colleagues and our local Managers asked the Hotel Management is not willing to research the case in a professional way.  This is really EMBARRASSING for such a house,

The weekend brunch is fantastic. I visit regularly and I observe non resident guests trooping in for meals especially on weekends. A hotel with good food will always rate high. 5 stars from me.  O. Olaye

A good hotel with professional staff. Always willing to help. The decor is modern and it has all the facilities one would expect in a top end city/business focused hotel. The Property is strategically located and easily accessible, the environment is in the central business district of Lagos. I am of the opinion that the maintenance culture should be sustained in line with standard of your other facilities around the world.

I fell in love with the Southern Sun Ikoyi Hotel rom my very first experience years ago. Four years on, the service, courtesies and food taste only keeps getting better. Its my first choice of business meetings and just cant think of any where else to recommend to friends and associates.

Having stayed in other Southern Sun properties in South Africa, i was wowed to see that Lagos service is second to none.  In details  The Staff i.e barternders are amazing they geniuely love what they are doing and are very passionate. They are very attentive and always have a smile.   The food  OMG amazing. Friday Sea Food Buffet is a must, it is eveything you want plus more, The snails, the prawns, hmm  Sunday Buffet best in lagos, it has a blend of African and Contiential at its best,   I have never stayed in the hotel but i always keep coming back for the food. Southern Sun is where you would go to to relax after a particlarly long day and you sure of quality service, good food and cold beers

Excellent service and way above average for Nigeria.   Room was very clean the shower a delight and the food was both of excellent quality and choice.   A very welcome oasis in the turmoil that is Lagos..

My stay at the Southern Sun exceeded all expectations. From the welcome at the lounge upon arrival, to my departure was faultless. The quality of accommodation was exceptional, the restaurant and bar areas all had a lovely ambience, service was impeccable and the food was excellent! The professional and friendly disposition of the staff is a great credit to the Hotel ‚Äì particular mention must go to the very cheerful chef who without any doubt took pride in his job. We were embarassed during the check out time as the guys in charge practicaly acussed us of  'stealing' from the room bar due to missing items they did not probably check with the previous occupants.

This is my fifth time in this hotel and I've never bothered to write a review until now. My last stay wasn't so good. The air conditioning wasn't cooling was very noisy. I called twice for someone to check it out and it was not resolve neither was I offered a different room. My friends in other room complained about the same issue. The breakfast was great and offered a good variety.

I have stayed in Southern Sun, Ikoyi. The location is good, with wonderful ambiance. The hotel has an admixture of leisure and business atmosphere. The rooms are cozy, I enjoyed the bathroom facilities, especially the huge cascading shower. The hotel's offering of cuisines, especially African delicacies, is wonderful. I looked forward to the meals during my stay. It was a wonderful experience. Southern Sun is one hotel I can recommend to travellers.  Okorie U.

Good Position, Kindly staff and good food. It is ok for business, but the range quality/price should be better. It is excellent for business meeting. The rooms are clean, good laundry service. Good place

My first experience of the hotel few years back was fantastic with spectacular facilities, atmosphere, serene and inviting. The rooms are plush and fitted to taste with good service culture and delivery. The meals are something else with a wide selection, especially African. You should try out the sunday brunch.  Repeat visits have never been disappointing

You have not tasted the best white fish yet until you have had it at Southern Sun!! The organisation at the hotel is highly commendable...oh and did I mention the gorgeous light skinned lady who stands right at the entrance of the restaurant? We were embarassed during the check out time as the guys in charge practicaly acussed us of  'stealing' from the room bar due to missing items they did not probably check with the previous occupants.

This is my fifth time in this hotel and I've never bothered to write a review until now. My last stay wasn't so good. The air conditioning wasn't cooling was very noisy. I called twice for someone to check it out and it was not resolve neither was I offered a different room. My friends in other room complained about the same issue. The breakfast was great and offered a good variety.

I have stayed in Southern Sun, Ikoyi. The location is good, with wonderful ambiance. The hotel has an admixture of leisure and business atmosphere. The rooms are cozy, I enjoyed the bathroom facilities, especially the huge cascading shower. The hotel's offering of cuisines, especially African delicacies, is wonderful. I looked forward to the meals during my stay. It was a wonderful experience. Southern Sun is one hotel I can recommend to travellers.  Okorie U.

Good Position, Kindly staff and good food. It is ok for business, but the range quality/price should be better. It is excellent for business meeting. The rooms are clean, good laundry service. Good place

My first experience of the hotel few years back was fantastic with spectacular facilities, atmosphere, serene and inviting. The rooms are plush and fitted to taste with good service culture and delivery. The meals are something else with a wide selection, especially African. You should try out the sunday brunch.  Repeat visits have never been disappointing

You have not tasted the best white fish yet until you have had it at Southern Sun!! My colleagues have come to know me for it as that's the thing I look forward to whenever I get a chance to have lunch there. Amazing stuff!  The organisation at the hotel is highly commendable...oh and did I mention the gorgeous light skinned lady who stands right at the entrance of the restaurant? She has the best smile and polite should be her middle name for real!
Review Text

Service I experienced during the my stay was excellent. Staff are friendly, polite and very professional. Excellent customer care and goes the extra mile to help guests. The room was spacious and decorated well.  It looked extremely well maintained with high quality furniture & linen. Bathroom was modern, spacious and extremely clean.  The hotel is located in a convenient, central location and looked  easy to get taxi eventhough I did not use taxis. On the whole it is an execptionally high quality hotel in a location where quality is an issue.

The Southern Sun is one of the nicer, if not the nicest full service hotel experience in Ikoyi.  The entire staff, regardless of position, greets you with a smile and seems to genuinely appreciate you being there.  I use the gym on a regular basis.  The facility is always clean and the machines are well maintained.  There is a good selection of weights, machines and cardio equipment (3 treadmills, 3 bikes, 2 elliptical machines).  Steam, sauna, and lockers are also available. The most memorable part of the gym are the 3 attendants (I believe their names are Hostraap, Mbom, and Tobenna).  They are eager to assist or train you, answer questions, demonstrate exercises, and motivate you to achieve your workout goals.  They are all an asset to the hotel and make exercising a bit more

Review Title: In Lagos?  This is a great hotel
Review Text: Wow. I hate coming to Lagos! My 1st impression and last of the country, both being at the airport, sour my feelings of the place every time I am here. But then I was advised to stay here. And even though its a business trip, it is fantastic. I have never had such efficient, happy and friendly assistance with anything I request. Its clean...fabulously clean! Rooms are big, hallways are quiet, and its extremely secure. Internet is free, and fast. This is a biggie for me. I cant speak highly enough of this property.

I've stayed here a number of times on business. The hotel is perfectly fine, not a bad oasis amongst all the chaos. If you're staying here you really need to be doing business on the island as the traffic across the bridge is chaotic. Nice gym, good bar and safe.

Some of the elevator buttons are faulty. I hurt my nail badly while pressing one of the buttons, however the button was promptly repaired when I pointed this out, but the remaining faulty buttons weren't checked or repaired. Room used to be hot when entering the room - it took an hour or so for the temperature to stabilize. The finishing of some of the items in the room was worn out. Alleys on my floor are too narrow. Shower is nice. Restaurant staff takes away plates too frequently. Hotel room is not good enough for the amount of rental being charged - that's probably because of the hotel's location. Pool is small. Restaurant users sit too close to the pool. Some of the reception staff need to have better English. Restaurant buffet lunch menu needs to have more continental

I have stayed at this hotel on several occassions. The only reason why I put myself throught he torture is the location being convenient to our clients and meetings. Please do not stay here if you expect consistency in service or facilities.   My list of unfortunate experiences on this trip are as follows: Air conditioning had to be replaced 2 times, Hot water was not working for 1 day, WIFI was spotty, room service took 1.5 hours to deliver sandwiches and a drink, got stuck in the lift 3 times while power was on for 2-3 minutes each time, Lobby bar and reastaurant service was terribly slow.  I see the hotel getting a lot of high ratings but cannot justify anything more than a 2/5 for this trip. The hotel management/owners seem oblivious to the slipping standards. Perhaps there

It isn't a particularly poor hotel, far from it, but there are nicer options in this category (local 4 Star/international 3 star). The Radisson Blu down the road on VI springs to mind! The location of the SS Ikoyi is very handy; right on Alfred Rewane Rd (formerly Kingsway) which is a major arterial between Ikoyi and Victoria islands. Staff were friendly and generally helpful but seemed to lack any desire to go that little further for their guests. None of the rooms I have stayed in were in great shape. There was invariably something amiss: a noisy AC, a leaky shower, a lose loo, poor wifi, etc. Nothing serious but

Good location and very well appointed hotel.  Small but effective pool area. Nice and cozy bar with the waiters eager to please...amazing spread for sunday brunch, you never know who you'll bump into...kids favorite and come back again and again for that.

Worst stay ever in my life!!! terrible experience. I booked for 2 adults online(which included breakfast). on checkout, I had a staff chasing me to the car park to come pay for breakfast for the second adult. I was practically labelled a thief. the useless staff and even their manager could not even figure out the booking was made for 2 adults which included breakfast. until I made so much notice and made them look like a food. not a recommended place!

It is a decent business hotel with lots of footfall. Conveniently located in the central place, it has decent room . The issue in the room is that it had a floor Ac unit with no digital temperature control and noise in the room. It even pulled in some smell from outside
Review Text

This is a well located and nicely run hotel in Ikoyi, Lagos. Good facilities, a decent bar and a good lounge on the 9th floor. The staff are friendly, helpful and caring. Getting around to the main business areas in Lagos from this hotel is quite easy. One of the better hotels to stay in in Ikoyi.

Review Title: Nice place to stay when on business
Review Text: Stayed here while on a business trip. The hotel is clean and the staff are very friendly and helpful. There is a security guard on every floor. The rooms are large and spacious, good selection of Africa business magazines are provided in the room. The only issue is the electricity, which is a problem experienced by the whole city, the on-off can be quite  disruptive, especially when the AC does not automatically switch on during the transition, not to mention the loud generator noise. They have a wide variety of food selection at the buffet, with a touch of local cuisine.

Southern Sun Ikoyi is cossy, quiet, neat and warm place to be. The staff are very courteous, customer-friendly and very responsive. The visible security is quite assuring and gives visitors no cause for alarm. Of course, the restaurant is not only well laid-out, the foods is worth the experience. In all I give them a 4. thumbs up!

Review Title: A bit tired. But not bad relative to Lagos
Review Text: Lagos is not exactly awash with fantastic hotels. But I would return to this one. The Southern Sun is a little older than others and rooms are small and somewhat tired but location is good and staff relatively helpful. Don't expect to check out quickly at peak hours - I gave up after 20 minutes. But at least the generators are quiet (on 7th floor). Word of caution - the adjacent lot at the back, overlooked by even room numbers is under construction. All night.

i had to chance to visit Nigeria during this week to attend IDC event, this is my first trip and we stayed at the Southern Sun Ikoyi. We arrived on sunday lunch time, the buffet was huge and has lot of choices as well the restaurant was full with both hotel guests and visitors a big 10 for the food in Sourthern sun in specific and the food in general in Lagos. I was given a room on the 5th floor which i didn't like the smell, but the staff was friendly and quickly gave an executive room on the 9th floor the last one and it has a nice view on the city. the room are enough for business, bathrooms are cleans and service is good.  The location is perfect it is in Ikoyi as well very near to Victoria Island.  The gym is acceptable it has enough machines to manage your daily exercises,

Used the SS Ikoyi Hotel in Lagos for a business trip recently and the hotel is good for Nigeria ( but it is not 4 star level by international standards).  The staff were both friendly and efficient. The breakfast restaurant's choice and quality of food was satisfactory. The rooms were small but well appointed (if a little threadbare) and room cleaning service was good. Well situated in Ikoyi.  All in all, if one is going to Nigeria for business then this hotel is a good place to stay.

The hotel is nice with a good location. though it's not that excellent. the hotel is pretty worn out. the rooms are very small. compared to Four Points, the rooms in Four Points are a lot better. The breakfast restaurant is excellent though. It's a lot expensive than Four Points; however, it's not better. I think on my next stay, I'll stay at Four Points to get more value for money.

splendid!certify that this review is my genuine opinion of this hotel, and that I have no personal or business affiliation with this establishment. A experience!!! Great place, great stay!  Great place, great stay!

I was most pleased by my recent stay at this hotel. The service was excellent and the room was very comfortable and soothing after a long day in Lagos' traffic :-) The dining options were great and has improved even from my last stay in January 2014. Keep up the great standards!

Stayed in Southern Sun Ikoyi hotel for a week end of April and found that hotel to be a very decent one.  There are limited choices when it comes for hotel in Lagos, Nigeria and no wonder this hotel is rated well by other tripadvisors. Firstly the staff in the hotel are super friendly and very polite and helpful. You ask for anything and they do their very best in making your stay a good one.  When it comes to hotel rooms the rooms are very decent however when you compare the cost one would pay I am sure its very costly but I guess that's how things are in Nigeria. You could spend your time in the hotel room well and there is nothing to complain about greatly. Having said that it could have been little more comfortable or luxurious but you can survive well and even happily whats
