We stayed for 4 days. Staff were very professional and friendly. They made us feel comfortable right from the lobby. Our room was clean, and the beds comfortable. The food is expensive but tasty. This hotel matches or exceeds the quality of many hotels around the world. We will return to this hotel in the future. We had a great time and restful stay.

I was in southern sun for 2 days. From the point I walked into the hotel the friendly staff and warm reception was very inviting. Lovely restaurant, wide choice of meals and dessert from the buffet display. The pepper soup was superb. Perfect environment and service. The staff were very handy and friendly. Loved it.true African hospitality.

very hospitable staff and management. good quality food. well run hotel.  I have been staying at this hotel for the past 4 years and find it difficult to find anything that can match up to it. there is a mix of different business types that frequent the hotel, so you are continuously surrounded by like minded people.

I stayed at this hotel last year on a business trip to Lagos. The hotel was spotlessly clean, the food wonderful and the service impeccable. Nothing was too much trouble and smiles from team members were in abundance. I would recommend to anyone visiting Lagos to use Southern Sun Ikoyi

What a great Hotel.   Its not easy nor cheap to do business in Nigeria but coming back every evening to a clean room friendly staff and made to feel welcome makes such a difference and I highly recommend the management, staff and well appointed location of this hotel.  I really feel part of the Tsogo Sun family and Mark thank you and your staff for the personal attention you always give me.

I can't complain about the hospitality nor service.  The room is just about 'fine'. Absolutely not for the price you pay, but then who comes here on their own expense?!  Breakfast is ok, normal and comparable for any other hotel worldwide.  But my one and biggest qualm I have of this hotel. If you don't have a lunch or buffet you are provided with a snack and/or bar menu.  As an example:  A hamburger (believe it was ham ?!): 1 burnt patty; 2 slices of tomato & some sliced onions topped up with a little tomato relish... 5kNGN, to put this in perspective - that's 22Euros; 325ZAR; 30USD. At least the roll was fresh this day.  Now, I see comments below that this is Lagos hotel prices & think this is a complete sham.  Regardless where you are in the world, you expect something pretty

Have been made to feel  like part the family - when staying at this hotel.  Always a wonderfull place to come to come home too after a tough day in Lagos.  excellent service and friendly and accomodating staff..

Excellent Lagos business hotel in a very convenient location . Reasonably central for travel within Lagos and the perfect place for formal meetings in their meeting rooms or informally in the lounges (best coffee I had in Nigeria )for both local and travelling business people.. Fantastic staff , very friendly with excellent service - which is difficult to find in Lagos.The food is of a very high standard and not outside the bounds of Nigerian high prices . Comfortable rooms which are well serviced .

Review Title: Good food and service, needs some maintenance
Review Text: Lagos Hotels are horribly expensive - so do not compare this to similar priced hotels in other countries or you will be extremely disappointed. Price aside, the service is excellent, staff are attentive and very friendly, and security is high. Breakfast is excellent with a very broad and high quality selection. The lunch and dinner  menus are Lagos hotel prices - so again horribly expensive, but the 'soup and salad buffet' will fill you up, is tasty and does not leave you feeling totally robbed. The rooms are good business-class standard, with comfortable firm beds, decent sized bathroom with coffee/tea in the room and free internet. Review Title: Great athmosphere to feel in Nigeria
Review Text: A very nice Business Hotel in a great location in the heart of Lagos. Despite the size of the Hotel the staff with its firendliness and professionality make every guest feel like at home.  I would recommend the Hotel to any Business traveller to Lagos.
Review Text

Very nice hotel, good food , service and friendly vibe in bar. One felt very safe in the hotel with gates well access controlled. A nice touch was having a `guard`/watcher on each floor during the day thus preventing easy access to the rooms during the day. The Business Center was also very helpful.

For service one of the best hotels in the world. Needs to refurbished though. Despite this great staff with a sense of humour. The awesome welcome from the concierge is genuine and now that they wear their native attire is inspirational.

I was thrilled to find out that my favorite Intercontinental Hotel has opened its doors in Lagos. After having stayed there for a week last month, I can say Southern Sun is still the best in this city.  I have stayed in this hotel previously.. You can find my earlier review on this link http://www.tripadvisor.co.uk/ShowUserReviews-g304026-d1438903-r174442657-Southern_Sun_Ikoyi-Lagos_Lagos_State.html#REVIEWS.  To summarize, perfect location, efficient Wifi, efficient handling of power fluctuation, good spread of breakfast, good food, prompt service at the restaurant and in-room dining, accomodating and helpful front desk staff. Safe, secure and clean. Staff welcoming. Stand out features: water pressure, excellent Wi Fi (Skype worked!), good food, comfy bed and pillows. However, rooms a bit small and furnishings need updating

Great hotel in lagos. Food was great and the employees made you  feel welcome. I found the wifi in the hotel the best in lagos no issue and had more than 1 device connected. I would recommend anyone to go and stay there.

It is always nice to come to Southern Sun Ikoyi Hotel - I feel to be back home. All staff does an excellent job. I had several stays already in this hotel and will not change to another house. This hotel is recommended as the best business hotel in Lagos. Will be back very soon.

Stayed here for five nights on a business trip. First room was on the first floor with no view except a ventilation duct and a parapet wall so asked to be moved on the second night. Rooms are quite small and rather tired and in need of an upgrade. A/C just about worked but was incredibly noisy - rather like being in the cabin of an aircraft in flight. So, not a good night's sleep to be had. Bathroom quite good but tiny. Staff generally helpful and friendly. Best thing about the hotel is the food - buffet breakfasts and dinner were outstandingly good, varied and utterly delicious. Beware the laundry - ¬£42 for three shirts, two trousers and a few bits of underwear. All in all, not good value.

It's only the location that makes this hotel even remotely attractive for business visits. The rooms are tiny and are in a desperate need of a face lift. The breakfast and wifi access are decent. My AC kept acting up. Would not rate this more than a 3 star property.

Moved to this hotel because I wasn't satisfied about my previous hotel (Moorhouse). The rooms are a little bit old fashioned, though overall very decent. The bed is comfortable, the shower is very nice, there's a hot water kettle and coffee/tea in the room. There's no free bottled water though, so you either have to go for boiling tap water or go for the way too expensive water bottle in your minibar. Also to be found in the room is a small safe and a large flatscreen TV with a fair choice of English TV channels. The airconditioner in the rooms is a bit older and can make quite a bit of noise although it does get the room cool. I stay in many hotels worldwide and this was very comfortable and friendly...the power outs are always frustrating but are a part of normal life here and the hotel was very well prepared and organised, staff very welcoming and friendly. Would certainly use again!

Review Title: Nice hotel, good service, rooms dated
Review Text: My wife and I recently stayed for 8 days, the hotel is clean, the food is good.  Our shower leaked every day, flooding the bathroom, the response was more towels to mop it up. Air conditioning not very cold, filter on unit was filthy.  Ok for a business hotel.

The reception I and my family got from this beautiful place was something else....I had my wedding reception there and it was perfect! I and my wife even got a complimentary cake and champagne from the hotel plus a complimentary dinner. I still feel sorry that my friends were a bit rowdy on the day, but the staffs were so courteous to each and everyone of us. Beautiful people all through.

Good rooms with very friendly staff. from the reception to the bar staff, everyone has service with a smile. Room has quality fittings. Unfortunately room rate is expensive, but then agian it is Lagos

The hotel is above average for a hotel in Africa. The service is good and the welcoming quite surprizing. The room is comfortable and clean. The bar area and restaurant has good variety and food quality very good. Will not be disappointed if you choose to stay here.

I started going to Southern Sun in 2009. From business meetings I planned there,  to family lunches and dinners. I have never seen a set of people willing to go the extra mile to make sure that you are comfortable and happy.   Personally,  I love Southern Sun because it is the only hotel my son would eat and not get a stomach bug!   For those short notice meetings I have to plan at work, all it takes is one phone call to Ubong (the PR/Sales Manager) and it's sorted. I call her Miss Fix It.  Planning a trip to Nigeria? Try Southern Sun. The hospitality radiates! The location is perfect! The food tastes great! And it is a safe and secure environment!

The service was very good and I like the room. The location and amenities are perfect except that the internet service was slow and fluctuating. What I like best about Southern Sun, food varieties. However, the tea is not very hot as I'd prefer.

Review Title: Memorable  Stay At  The Southern Sun Hotel Ikoyi Lagos Nigeria
Review Text: The overall service was very good, and more especially, the welcoming drink and the nuts, sweets and tasteful chocolates , were very exceptional and must commend the management teams. The room was very clean and location of amenities were strategically placed l loved the fast flow of the big blast showers best and lovely cosy bed sheets and beautiful aircondition room, all these made staying at the Southern sun hotel very comfortable.

My room was clean , so was the bathroom !front office staff were very friendly and respectful!food quality was very nice !hotel security by the gate outside very rude . But I had a lovely time and will keep coming bck .

This is a very nice hotel in an excellent location! The amazing staff is courteous and helpful from the moment you arrive at their door. The head of their Sales and PR staff, Ms Nseobot, is a young professional, I have interacted with on more than one occasion, who handles inquiries promptly and with total confidence. The food there is excellent, whether it be dinner, lunch, or canapes. I actually look forward to the eating there,  The staff are friendly and helpful, most especially the Public Relations Manager Ubong, she definitely goes over and above the required. If you are ever in Lagos, this is the hotel to stay.  PS. Remember to ask for my favorite meal, the Chicken Atete!

I cannot believe a business would employ someone so terrible at customer service.

Friendly hotel.  The location is very good. With easy access to VI and Lekki. (And mainland Lagos)  The food is awesome. lunch is almost like a banquet.   The rooms are spacious and clean. Hotel staff are extremely friendly and always have a smile.

The reception team were unfriendly, not helpful, and showed no warmth during my check in or check out process. On the other hand, the breakfast and dinner team were very helpful and provided service with a smile.

The hotel is in a choice location and the staff honestly try their very best. However, I just can't get over the lack of backup power (I mean even the elevators shut down) and tiny rooms after paying so much!

It was my third visit to Lagos and stayed in Southern Sun as always. Its a very secure hotel with great facilities and peaceful environment, also its very close to my office on Osborne road. Would recommend this hotel to all the Lagos visitors.

My experience at the southern sun hotel was impressive. I thoroughly  enjoyed the dinner i had there. The layout and spread was impeccable and from the onset you can immediately see that it was extremely well managed. The waiters are friendly and the service top class. The food was well prepared and i savoured every minute of it. Thank you southern sun for mouth watering dinner.

A stay at this luxurious hotel situated in the heart of Lagos state! the Centre of Excellence in Nigeria is a true picture of the term" value for money"  Wonderful architectural use of space, well equipped gym facilities, the sauna is heavenly and all is complimentary for guest use. The only downside is d pool location which is too close to the restaurant and hence evades privacy.  Courteous staff and good customer service
Review Text

I have stayed at the Hotel many times and have never had an issue, bar & pool area great, only complaint, service can be a bit slow at times.  Rooms are clean and well serviced. Room serice menu a little limited (when you been there 3 weeks)  Great hotel and is highly recommended.

Review Title: Well Maintained and excellent in VI area

....we had diner at this hotel and enjoyed the courteous service.....but the quality of the finishing especially at the entrance lobby is poor seems they hotel was quickly finished for the opening. Generally, the food was very nice....

The Southern Sun in Lagos is very much like many four star business hotels you find all over the world. The service is good and the rooms small but adequate. The hotel only has one restaurant which is a bit limited since you are often stuck to your hotel when it comes to food in Lagos. I have a business trip to stay in Southern Sun Ikoyi Hotel, Lagos, Nigeria. I was told that is a best hotel around west Africa. But by my personal experience stay in this hotel. The basic facilities is normal but services is Ok.  The air conditioner did not work well for my room and also for my colleague's room. I wish it will be improve next time when visit here again.

This wasa great experience,  The staff are welcoming and friendly and the guest is the absolute priority. Everyone from the porters to the concierge to the security staff really made me feel comfortable.  The rooms are spacious comfortable. Also the WiFi is free and very strong. This is an essential and very rare quality in Nigeria.  I was very impressed with the nightly buffet. There is so much variety of excellent food.  Also, it is usually advisable notto bok hotel transfers directly from the hotel in Lagos. This is not the case at Southern Sun. The hotel drivers are trustworthy and professional.  I look forward to staying here again!

From the staff on the door, to the reception or someone just calling the lift -they understand how to make ones custom feel appreciated. Good job to Mark Loxley and his team!  Best Regards,  Ben K, London

Well done

Review Title: A fine hotel for Business travelers
Review Text: A safe neighborhood and convenient property location for Business travelers.  The rooms are clean and well kept.  The staff is courteous, and especially Jennifer the Front Desk Manager was very helpful and friendly. Lobby area, bar, restaurant all very clean, tidy, and welcoming with attentive staff. Bedroom of a good standard for decent hotel - good bed, nice bathroom, quite spacious, good aircon. Had most meals in the hotel - buffet style and al a carte, good choice, good standard. Hotel wide wifi which was fast and reliable. Location was pretty good for my needs - not bad for the airport, reasonable for downtown - crazy traffic aside - but the hotel can't control that - unfortunately! I would use

I used to stay at another hotel in Lagos until I was introduced to the Southern Sun.  It is a good value and best of all, the staff, rooms and food are first class.  The internet works very well.  They treat me very well with always a smile.  I will continue to stay at the Southern Sun Ikoyi Hotel.
Review Text

Review Title: One of the few expensive options available in Lagos you can still go for
Review Text: Hotels in Lagos are generally expensive and it's difficult to get a decent room for less than 300 usd per night, due to its location , southern sun is a preferred choice for business travellers. The staff is generally courteous and hospitable however sometimes you feel that price you pay is more than the value you get but that is the case with most other hotels available in Lagos

Review Title: Excellent service experience at The Southern Sun Ikoyi Lagos
Review Text: I've been staying at the Southern Sun Ikoyi, Lagos each time I travel to Nigeria for a few years now. I wish to commend the Hotel staff for the good service and the special interest they take in their guests. I've not had  any reason to complain so far. A special thanks to the Front Office Manager Jennifer Meke. She works tirelessly to make sure my stay is as comfortably and as smooth possible. Well done!

Review Title: Excellent services at Southern Sun Ikoyi Hotel
Review Text: From beginning to end, the experience was an absolute joy. The room i stayed in was clean, well stocked and relatively spacious. The staffs always had a smile and were extremely helpful. The breakfast (included) was the perfect fuel for a day traversing this hectic city. Its location is ideal to explore the city without having to reside right in the thick of it.  Not many four star hotels in Lagos offer free wireless services to guest and i guess it was the hotel's way of adding value. It was a great experience staying at Southern Sun Hotel and one hopes to repeat it very soon. All the staff gave that little bit extra and left me with lasting memories .

Review Title: Business meeting at the Southern Sun Hotel
Review Text: Having a business meeting at the Southern Sun Hotel is comparable to any of the meetings I have held in most five star hotels in Europe. The recent meeting of the Arbitration Committee of the International Chamber of Commerce, Nigerian National Committee which was held at the Southern Sun Hotel is a good case in point. The arrangement of the meeting room was excellent and very gorgeous. The snacks supplied were different, delicious and suitable for the meeting. Attendees were very happy and impressed, with everyone saying that the ICC Arbitration Commission meeting has been taken to another level.  This is clearly one of my favorite hotels in Nigeria. Dorothy Udeme Ufot, SAN.

Review Title: Staying at the Southern Sun Ikoyi Lagos
Review Text: As a regular client of SS, I was until this weekend a huge fan of your breakfast and weekend brunches having enjoyed numerous culinary delights with your array of food/dishes and choices since my return to Nigeria in the last year and more. Your chef should truly be commended as he and his team have kept these meals interesting, tasty, filled with variety while keeping it fun.  However, my weekend stay has allowed me the opportunity to enjoy your accommodation on a different level and also experience your room service.  I was impressed with the professional friendliness of the room service desk who were knowledgeable and accommodating to my breakfast in bed order but also encouraged me to try breakfast downstairs at the restaurant. The food arrived within the 30minutes promised

Southern Sun Ikoyi is an excellent place to stay at especially for business. The ambience is nice complemented with cheerful and hospitable staff. Samuel Muiruri is quite helpful always ensuring that you are comfortable.Service is simply very good.  Food is Simply exquisite. It was pleasant to have the Chef (Stanley) come up and enquire on the quality of the food  The AC is abit noisy though.

Review Title: RECOMMENDATION OF SOUTHERN SUN IKOYI HOTEL
Review Text: My review on Sounthern Sun Ikoyi as a customer  is the service is sincerely top of the range compared to most hotels. I am pleased with the dedication, politeness, on time response, professionalism of the management / general staff and i took note of a particular outstanding staff named Mr. Lawal on his tag that is up and about all over the hotel ensuring customer satisfaction as i have stayed in hotels all over the world and i was impressed by observing his overwhelming zeal  service to all that i had to highly commend him and  mentioned this in my  review plus  recommend the  hotel to others.  conclusion southern sun ikoyi  is  an excellent Hotel.

I came for 5 days on a business trip into this hotel and was really impressed about location, service, rooms and team of this hotel. I know other places in Lagos, but this hotel is the best solution at present.

The service at the Southern Sun Ikoyi is outstanding. I stayed here for two nights during a business trip to Lagos. My room was generally nice. The bathroom was adequate and included a separate tub and shower. I found the shower arrangement to be a bit awkward. The breakfast buffet is excellent with many different options. I also had dinner at the hotel one night and found it to be quite good. As is the case with most hotels in Nigeria, the Southern Sun Ikoyi is expensive.

Review Title: A good option for a business traveler in Lagos
Review Text: This is my third hotel in Lagos in about three years and, even though there is nothing particularly noticeable about it, the overall experience at the Southern Sun is a positive one, which is certainly an achievement in this city. Yes, it's expensive for what it is, the pool is tucked between the all day restaurant and the drop off area, the rooms are only average, the views are nothing special and it generally feels like it needs help but on the other hand, the staff is very positive and helpful, the restaurant has an amazing buffet, the security is very efficient, the business center is in order and above all, it really feels like a well run business hub. I would definitely come back.
Author Location: New York, New York, United States

Review Text: Review Text

The room was fine if uninspiring. The hotel is well run and secure. The food was fine and the public spaces OK. A decent enough option in Lagos.  Not really much more to say but I am sure there are far worse places to stay in this city!

I have been a frequent traveller to Lagos for business over the past couple of years. i have always stayed at the Southern Sun Ikoyi Hotel. It is very expensive, but so is every other hotel in Lagos. You do not get the value for money, but it is still a good hotel with all facilities of a high standard. The staff are always smiling and eager to assist.  Don't ask for soft poached eggs, it will tkae many atempts to get this correct. :)

Review Title: Warmest , most welcoming and helpful team in Lagos
Review Text: Stayed again recently for ten days....a test for most hotels . Mark Loxley and his superb team must be congratulated on running such a fine hotel in this vibrant , bustling city. The Hotel is incredibly busy yet the staff find time to smile , engage, and constantly check that all is well .The chef produces a consistently good buffet and sufficient , good variety in the other menus to prevent the tedium of long stay dining. I must recommend this hotel very highly, again.

Ever since I first experienced the the Southern Sun in Ikoyi in July 2012 that is where I stay when I'm in Nigeria for business. After three stays there the last one being in October from the 14 to the 20th, I can say the service is great and the staff is very attentive when I express a need. Jennifer Meke and Simeon Odegor among other staff members really make my stay at Souther Sun worth it. People pay attention to what I need and are always eager to help out.  After a long day going from meeting to meeting especially with the crazy traffic, there is nothing like going back to a hotel where you know you will not have to worry about anything. The food is good, their gym well equiped and the service is of excellent quality.

Review Title: Great hotel, very safe and secure location.
Review Text: Although very expensive ($342/night), the hotel gives an immediate feeling of safety upon arrival. Staff are attentive and polite. Rooms are tidy, although quite small (compared to similar hotels in Europe). Wi-fi is free, but did not work at all during my stay. Even though reported, it remained not working. Breakfast buffet is excellent.

For my first visit to Lagos and Nigeria, this hotel presented the best side of the country. A well fitting venue for the launch of our Best of Nigeria book. After being told that no one is ever on time in Lagos, the function room was fantastic and prepared way ahead of time giving us ample time to get ready for our event. The accommodation service was simply divine and was topped off with a cake to celebrate my birthday - a nice little touch that warmed my heart. Special thanks to one employee of the hotel Ubong, her energy, passion and attention to detail is just great. Now i look forward to being back to Nigeria and this hotel,

Review Title: Amazing Experience... Smiles all the way!!!
Review Text: Organised a conference recently, the staff were friendly and supportive. Amazingly, everything seemed to work, from technical set up to timely response and service. Not to forget, the food was excellent too. It was indeeed a plesant experience for me and my guest.

Expensive, but clean, safe and comfortable.  Service was excellent - all staff were friendly, polite and helpful.  Clearly there has been some very good customer service training.  Some nice small things, like getting a cold drink when you check in and some water when you leave.  Rooms are small, but pleasant enough.  Wireless worked most of the time.  It is on its own system, so it would stay on even when the main power cut out.  Restaurant food was mediocre, but better than you usually get for hotels in Nigeria.  Bar was comfortable, but the bar staff could use some training - one couldn't manage a rum and coke.  Make sure that this is the location you need.  If your appointments are in a different part of Lagos, it can take a very long time to get out here because of traffic.

Review Title: Where to stay on Lagos island ? is Ikoyi the answer ??
Review Text: I stayed in Lagos for a week sampling 3 hotels; 2 in Ikoyi and one in Ikeja.  If you are looking for a decent hotel in Ikoyi area then this may be the hotel for you, it was the best of the lot I stayed in during Oct/Nov 2012 .  The hotel is pleasant overall, the rooms are decent, and the facilities are adequate.  Security will not be an issue in any of the major hotels of this status in Lagos.  The location is good although the traffic in Lagos is something else....  The food selection during breakfast and dinner should satisfy most, with a selection of both local and continental dishes.    The 2 down sides I noticed was the price you pay which was almost 500 USD a night and the gym airconditioning  ( facilities were average) but they say it is open all hours but the

This hotel is one of the best I have ever stayed in africa. Sited in a very good location, well trained and respected staff with good looking and well furnished rooms. I had a little issue with the aircondition and water in my room at night during my stay that I need to send for the maintenace. The hotel needs to improve on maintenance, I can't imagine one person attending to several issues(electrical, plumbing and aircondition), the maintenance guy try is very best but its really appalling. Above all I think your hotel will always be my choice of stay in nigeria.
Review Text

Five star but rather bland. Rooms very small and cramped, security guards everywhere, tiny pool area making the 'tanning'  process rather hard. Good gym and a small bar. The buffet is great and the a la carte is fine but a limited menu. Service at the bar and restuarant is slow but attentive. This hotel is normally full of Lagos' 'great and the good', big wigs and ministers etc, great for the business traveller, however the nearby Radisson draws a much younger and trendy crowd. The WIFI is patchy at best. But when it comes to value for money it just doesn't add up. There is no way the service, decor or rooom layout justifies the price. Review Title: Truely one of the very BEST hotels in LAGOS!!
Review Text: Excellent service right from the time you step into the hotel. Very warm and friendly staff,  especially at the reception.  Exceptionally elegant rooms. Special rooms provided on request. Tremendous food quality and selection.  Wide range of cocktails and other alcoholic beverages prepared by one of the finest bar tenders in the city. Top class recreational facilities with highly trained instructors. Prioritized check out facilities available for your comfort. Excellent location for your safety and comfort. Special thanks to  Paul, Peter, Sandra and Lawal for making my visits a memorable one each time. Highly recommended for a pleasant business trip and a good family stay. Go for it!!

Very good and friendly staff. Rellay hospitable. Everything was assisted by the staff right from the time u step u r foot into southern sun. During buffa service regularly checked our table and asked for any assistance and always offered something. F&B Manager, Mr. Jonathan and his team are doing good job. Food is amazing...the Fish was one of the most tasteful fish. Perhaps its the sea. Asked for a la carte service and offered one of the best chicken dish offered by the Chef...Overall very very good experience..i would recommened to every1 southern sun in Lagos.

Very good, respectfully and dedicated staff. Amazing food and very good hospitality.Right from d check in time to the time of checking out we were met and assisted by very dedicated staffs with all smiles. Will recommend to friends anytime, keep it up...

Review Title: Southern Sun Lagos - Does it in Style
Review Text: Having been in Nigeria for nearly two months and having stayed at many hotels and other forms of accommodation, this hotel was not only a breathe of fresh air, but also brings 1st class and 1st word standards to West Africa.  From the decor, to the staff, the executive rooms and facilities, there is a golden thread that runs through everything, bringing continuity and style to the table, and you are never left wanting or disappointed. The General Manager, Mark Loxley is certainly no different.  He adds that extra touch of personal attention to his guests and to every detail. Being in the Travel Industry, pleasing me is certainly no easy task, yet I was not only pleased, but utterly delighted.  I will certainly not only be staying here every time I am in Lagos, but will advise

All member of staff are extremely kind and warm and will always be the first to greet you. If you have the time, they will even find out how your day is coming so far.  The breakfast (complimentary) is great and you have a wide range of dishes to choose them. I have had dinner a couple of time and I can say that I was not disappointed. I am yet to try their giant shrimps (I heard they are delicious) though, but when I do, I will sure do write about my experience. I recently stayed at the Ikoyi for a period of 2 weeks. I found everything to be of extremely high standard and quality.  Check in was quick and easy, although it took a few minutes since there were patrons before me and it was late.  The room was very comfortable, neat and clean.   All the staff were friendly, polite and accommodating from reception, to house cleaning, room service and gym trainers  The meals were good, and the buffet breakfast offered a good range to choose from.

I have stayed at Southern Sun Ikoyi numerous times in the last few years, on business trips to Lagos. It has a super location on the Island (Ikoyi), staff quite professional and always courteous. It has struck me that the hotel has consistently given me a very good standard of service. The rooms are well appointed and clean. Bathrooms modern and functional. (Many times the rooms I have stayed in have had no baths in the bathroom, but with roomy power shower cubicles). View from rooms not so great, as hotel is smack in the middle of a busy/bustling area. Rooms are quiet though, as hotel is well set back from the roads, no noise from outside.  Their check-in processes are quite swift and at the check-in counter you always get someone standing by you offering a tray with a nice

I had a business meeting in the hotel on 28 Sep 12 at the breakfast room and forgot a very valuable folder on the chair. I was worried thinking I had lost it. The next day I went to the hotel to check if it was found by anyone.....staff or guest. All the staff I asked were helpful especially the duty manager Mr Samuel who got the folder and handed it back to me after verification. I couldn't believe it. This is an indication of the quality of staff and services in the Southern Sun Hotel.  I commend the management and staff of the hotel. Keep your friendly, helpful and honest attitude up. You have become my hotel of choice.

This was truly a lovely experience.  Friendly staff, good food, excellent rooms, modern gym!!! Enjoyed every minute of my stay.  Location is vey convenient and service is outstanding.  I have stayed in many hotels in Lagos and there is no comparison to the Southern Sun.  Will never stay in another hotel and looking forward to my next stay.

I have stayed at this hotel 4 times over the last year, and will return again.  I have stayed at all of the competitors - Federal Palace, Radisson Blu, Eko, Wheat Baker, and I think that the Southern Sun beats them all, based on the quality of their staff who care a lot about customer service, and frankly, want good reviews on Trip Advisor.  First - excellent wifi - had recently been in a hotel in London whose wifi was not as strong or as reliable as what I experienced at Southern Sun.  Second - I held an event at their conference facility.  We had a miscommunication about how many people to cater for, and I was presented with a bill substantially higher than what I expected.  However, the food and beverage catering manager resolved the matter very effectively, which is a rare

I stayed in Southern Sun Hotel ikoyi, Lagos sometime around August 2011 and ever since then I've never ceased to long for more. I love the room i stayed - decent and clean. The hotel staff are wonderful. I can't forget the promptness with which they attend to guests' requests and needs. In particular. I remember how one of them by name Nseobot assisted me and my colleagues when we had issues with the conference room we were to use. It was a sweet experience for me as I also made new friends, one of which is an important business associate now On the other hand I wished the compound was a bit bigger but this cannot take away the other nice aspects. I can say am looking forward to staying there again whenever I can

Review Title: Good atmosphere, good staff, good food
Review Text: Management really know what they are doing, staff are polite and not obtrusive , food ( buffets were also very good). Great choice of channels in the room, BBC , SKY, movies , and my favourite CI channel plus others . If I'm honest I couldn't really fault the service , rooms were a bit on the small size, but hey you can't have it all, would definately stay again , business or pleasure it ticks all the boxes .

Absolute warmth and professionalism every time i visit the hotel. Impeccable service all through the hotel. However,i have always experienced a smell of dumpness everytime i opened the room upon check in. The rest of my experiences in the hotel have just been Great!

Review Title: A place which is like home
Review Text: I work as a cabin crew and almost every night I stay in different hotel, in different country. I can say Southern Sun Ikoyi hotel is one of my favorite! Is one of the places where I feel myself home :) Comfortable rooms, delicious food and what is the most important very very nice staff!

its a great experience with this hotel,its the best hotel n thecustomer oriented people workin with great skills of hospitality,./i would always keep comin to this hotel n recomend all my friends to visitn try the hospitality n service which is just amazing,./

Exellent hospitality and great service. The staff are wonderfull especially Mr Lawal the assistant F&B manager. Recommend to everyone who are visiting Lagos to used the hotel. Clean and comfortable room too.

Excellent hotel, nice rooms, great staff especially Mr Lawal, and lovely food.. As a flight attendant my company uses SS hotel and I love the hotel cos its close to home and after a hectic flight it takes me 5-10mins to get home to my family.. I would recommend the hotel to anyone visiting lagos..Keep up the great work....... Uvie

Hello everyone..my name is jaydeep and i am a frequent customer staying in sourthern sun hotel.. And with my experience i would highly recommend people travelling to lagos for business or leisure to hire this hotel for the stay..as this hitel is excellent in there service , right from the begining of entring into the hotel from bell desk to having food in there restraunt.. Would highly appreciate the service,true gesture,hospitality and approach of Mr. Lawal Agugi and his team for making my stay more comfortable with reference to food as i am a strict vegetarian and he really helped me a lot in that.. Thank u very much lawal, his team front office staff and complete sourthern sun hotel for making my stay worth and offering genuine hospitality and service Cheers guys cu soon....

Awesome! is how I can describe this hotel. From the moment you walk into the lobby to the time you check out, you sense the warmth in the hotel's staff. They all seem eager to know how your stay at the hotel was... which really makes you feel cared for. Housekeeping, room service and any requests made is handled with exceptional speed... someone knocks on your door the moment you put the hotel's phone receiver down... talk of efficiency!!! Special mention, Mr. Lawal, who ensures your stay there is as comfortable as possible. I recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Lagos.   5 star cabin crew.

We travel to this hotel everyday in a group though with different group,we are a cabin crew working for a Five Star Airline.We get Five star treatment from this hotel,from the entrance we get a welcome greetings from the workers at d door,they help in carrying our suit case,getting in d reception another welcome greetings from the manager populaly known as Mr Lawal,his friendly that before we get to the hotel all crew talk about and look forward to meet him because he always make every request possible for both we nigerian crew and d foreignres among us and he goes around during dinner to see if everybody is okay with the meal not just to the crew also to other custormers,his a good manager.And also d lovely welcome cookies and the drinks given to us before going to our rooms it

I stayed here for three nights and had no problems. Prices are high in Lagos and we paid $250 per night. The air conditioner was noisy but that was the only problem that I experienced during my stay at this hotel.
The room was very welcoming.You have everything you need there.Very comfy. The buffet in the restaurant is very nice n tasty. A worthly experience. :))  Qatar Airways crew

Stay at this hotel when in Lagos and enjoy it very much.  It is expensive, but all good ones are in Lagos.  No fuss lobby does not make for an ideal business meeting location, and the hotel also has no conference facilities.  Other than that the lobby bar and the restaurant have a intimate feeling to them, with the limited seating in the lobby area often causing some congestion.  Wifi offered throughout the building, but power outages and line problems cause intermittent connectivity issues from time to time.  Staff are generally friendly and competent.  Rooms are small but comfortable.  Food is always good if buffets are your thing.  To be honest I get tired and cannot wait to order off a menu at times, so personally this style of buffet restaurant is not a favorite of mine.

Review Title: Destressing Break In a Stressful City
Review Text: How can you maintain tranquility within chaos? Working and living in a fast paced and busy city like Lagos will eventually take its toll on you. I needed immediate break within my working & living environment to get away from it all. Southern Sun Ikoyi gave me exactly the quiet getaway I desired. Clean room, well stocked fridge (in my standard room!), sumptuous b/fast, professional and friendly staff (thanks Ms Ubong!). I still dont get how tranquility within the chaos that is Lagos is achieved. Well done!

SS Ikoyi is probably one of the best hotels in Nigeria of course by Nigerian standards. Its pricy but you will get the best service compared to most hotels around. Perfect for business trips, good food, clean hotel and friendly staff - thats always a bonus for me.

The hotel is nice and clean. the staff are friendly and helpful.. the food is overpriced and not very good quality at all.. it is a nice place to meet up for business meetings or happy hour....it is located in ikoyi and easily accessible to Vi.. traffic permitting.. overall, nice hotel, prices a bit steep, but as most hotels in lagos this is to be expected..

Review Title: Good hotel nice clean rooms. Overpriced.
Review Text: For Lagos standard good/excellent. International this would be a average hotel. The Nigerian rates are just too steep for the quality you get.

SS Ikoyi is one of the best hotels for business travellers in Nigeria. I have been staying there for the past 2 years and have always left after every visit with much satisfaction. Its in the heart of the business district in Lagos and in close proximity to a lot of relaxation spots.

Great front of house team in terms of reception and biz centre, bar and restaurant guys/girls were excellent, very attentive and polite. Room staff did a great job in cleaning and replenising mini bar, towels and sheets. Security very good both at the gate and on each floor. Used the gym and the equipment was modern,well kept and the gym was not busy early morning. GM kept all staff on their toes, which is important as the competion at the new hotel (no.1 on TA) will steal the regular visitor to Lagos. Food good. Busy hotel, well located but rooms could do with a bit of an update as showing their age (only a few years old!). Would stay here again, but next time would try the Wheatbaker just to compare.
Review Text

Consistency is it for me...I have stayed at Southern Sun Lagos about 6 times in the last 1year and its always been a memorable trip....Staff very warm,Professional,Kind.The food at the restaurant Always Fresh, Tasty and a good Variety.  Everything really is just right and worth your money....  Daisy

For anyone visiting Lagos I heartily recommend staying at the Southern Sun Ikoyi.   This is my third stay here and there is nothing I can fault.   The staff are friendly, professional and extremely helpful. The rooms are clean, spacious and air-conditioned, with a very comfortable bed and all the TV channels you could want.  The always-on free WiFi internet is a massive plus, as is the fully equipped business centre.  Every time your room gets serviced you will find two or three sealed bottles of still mineral water ready for you.   The food is very good indeed ‚Äì lavish breakfasts, sumptuous buffets, superb steaks and seafood, excellent curries and a range of really delicious traditional Nigerian dishes. Review Title: But, I loove Southern Sun Ikoyi
Review Text: I stayed here for work, 3 nights, because I needed to be near my company's international guests. Customer Service was on point, no one wasted my time or that of the guests I had booked for, the food is so good there, you get a decent choice of continental and traditional. My favourite experience however was the bed, my bed was clean and comfortable and the right kinda firm and the curtains blacked out everything..................... Lush!!! Loved it, will go back.

Good hotel with good service. Good restaurant, although when you eat there the whole week you find out that the food bar is the same all week. Swimming pool is a joke. Good for the mosquitoes. I would certainly recommend this hotel

Review Title: An oasis in a city of chaos!!
Review Text: Went as part of an organised group trip. Absolutely fantastic in every respect and nothing is too much trouble. Mark Loxley, the GM, should be really proud of the team he has and he's a real nice guy too. Oh, and the security is very good also!
Review Text
Finally a hotel in Lagos that works.  Food = v. good for LOS A/C is noisy and in some rooms thermostat is broken. Watch the bill on check out, staff maths not too good! Not found better to-date...
Good place, good room, good bathroom, good service, good food, small swimming pool. T make a long story short, good place for business.
Good business hotel, but I wish the rooms had quieter air-conditioners. The noise spoils a good night's sleep.

The Southern Sun Ikoyi team showed an extremely high level of professionalism and provided a very high quality venue backed-up by excellent service and catering. I am yet to see any other establishment come even close to this high standard in Nigeria. The Southern Sun Ikoyi staff are a credit to the brand and we will most certainly be using the facility again.

Review Title: Peaceful oasis within the hussel and chaos of Lagos
Review Text: Great all round. Comparable to any high standard western hotel. Great buffet food. Friendly staff, great service. Very clean facilities.

Review Title: One of the best hotels in Nigeria & Africa
Review Text: This is a exceptional cordial, friendly hotel I have stayed here on business last year for over 6 months, and thiis my regular port of call hitherto. From the CEO; senior management, front desk staff, concierge, housekeeping and the superb restaurant staff and cuisine. This is authentic, not a play or an act in warm customer welcome and service...The service is real...Try it

Value for money top class hotel comparable with anywhere in 1st word. Extremely well managed with well trained staff and the faciliaties and amenities extremely adequate.Accomodation,business meetings ,food and beverage and administative support all can be benchmarked versus the best . Location is a plus and conveniently positioned to the business hubs of lagos as well as leisure and entertainment.

I have stayed at Southern Sun during my recent  business trip to Lagos for 2 days ( Feb 26-27 ). One of the best experience I have had out of all the hotels I have stayed worldwide. Staffs were very nice and helpful, foods were awesome ( best ethnic choice of foods ), clean ream and awesome shower.  Mark - GM was very nice. Thank you so much Mark, to put together best team in your hotel.  You guys are awesome, this was my first trip to Africa and my stay at Southern Sun makes it memorable one.  Thank you.  Anir Joshi

Review Title: The best business hotel experience for some time
Review Text: The Southern Sun Ikoyi Hotel made my 4 day business trip to Lagos extremely smooth; comfortable and seamless. The meeting room and business facilites are excellent, and with large comfortable rooms and an excellent restaurant and bar area, I enjoyed my stay in Lagos. This location and the hospitality form the GM to the front of house staff, will make this hotel my preferred business hotel in this large and bustling City.

Review Title: It doesn't get better than this ...
Review Text: AWESOME is the word. Expensive but worth it. Every aspect was good about it however swimming pool could have been better. It is just too small and enclosed with boundaries just too close. Otherwise, every other thing about hotel will make you special.

Had been to Nigeria for the second time in the last 6 months, for a business meeting. I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel in Lagos. This must be the best hotel Lagos currently has suiting the needs of business travellers. The check in was handled quite efficiently. The rooms are quiet, clean and new, quite spacious. The bathrooms are well appointed too, but for a foul smell emanating from it, maybe some leaking plumbing in some pipelines. I could not be bothered too much about it for lack of time. The staff is very attentive, the breakfast spread was quite good too. Once inside, its like any good 4star hotel anywhere in the world. Easily the best business hotel in Lagos, for now, but you have to pay dearly for it, doesnt come cheap!!

I travel to Nigeria on business approximately six to eight times a year and have been for the past three years. During my time I have stayed in several of the hotels which Nigeria has to offer.  To date (in Lagos), the Southern Sun Ikoyi has been without a doubt my hotel of choice. January 2011 was my eighth stay at the Southern Sun and on average I stay for ten working days at a time.  I regularly will use the hotel to host business meetings and client entertainment which has yet to prove a bad choice.  The accommodation is always outstanding and when there has been something to sort out, it has been dealt with immediately. Nothing is too much trouble for the team there. Review Title: This hotel provided an excellent conference facility with great service to back it up.
Review Text: I needed to host a workshop with one of my largest clients in Nigeria. Facilitirs for such a meeting are common enough in Lagos, but the quality of the supporting equipment (projectors, PA, etc.) is usually sadly lacking. The Southern Sun Ikoyi provided me with a clean and well equiped room complete with air conditioning, notepads and all of the usual paraphenalia that is taken for granted in other parts of the world, and then topped it off with good quality coffee and snacks and a scrumptious lunch (catering for both local and western cuisine) to close. This all happened according to the times stipulated in my agenda, another regional first. I will certainly use the venus again.

Review Title: Good business hotel, well located, pleasant staff
Review Text: This hotel was clearly built to accommodate businessmen and it serves well its purpose. Located in Ikoyi, easily accessible, well guarded (unfortunately an important criteria in Lagos), it offers not so big rooms, but large enough for a solo traveller (if you are two, try to get a larger room though) and well laid out. Breakfasts are good, as food is in general. There is however only one restaurant, buffet style (they have a menu, but very limited). So if you plan to stay for a while, you might want to organise some dinners outside... Very friendly and efficient staff. Free wifi internet of decent quality. Swimming pool. Business centre and meeting rooms... In short, a very good option when on business trip in Lagos.

Review Title: Excellent pesonal service and great facilities
Review Text: We have clocked up over 300 room nights in the last two years and we were never disappointed.  Well done and keep up the good work!

Review Title: Well Located hotel with all you want!
Review Text: Most of the hotels that are good in Lagos are very expensive, so this one is no exception, costing about N60000 a night! The staff is very courteous, but at times are sloppy. Rooms are small, but you get all you want in the room and in the hotel. The gym and swimming pool are the best part. The hotel has only one restaurant, so it gets boring sometimes. Internet is free!

Review Title: Splendid-i got a 20% discount with saversQ Discount card
Review Text: It was a very wonderful experience at Souther sun Ikoyi,very comfortable rooms,their restaurant serves good meal,the staff are also well trained and as for the location ,it's just too perfect.To crown it all up,i got a 20% discount using SaversQ discount card.

Review Title: The staff is friendly and accomodating.
Review Text: The staff helped me get catering for our aircraft. They did a great job going out of their way to fulfill my needs. Great people to work with.
I travel to lagos frequently and try to stay in a different hotel each time - this hotel I must say was up to standards and the food was great!

Review Title: If you're working in Lagos this is perfect
Review Text: Lagos is one slightly mad, chaotic and unpredictable place. Its also one humming city always on the hustle.  The Southern Sun, if you're only in town for a few days & especially if you're working, is the one place to head to. In comparision to the competition its very good, everything runs like clockwork & the staff are all really helpful.   The only negative is that its packed with oil, gas & telecoms people all too scared to venture out without the armour-plated 4x4. The consequence is that they're all in the bar. If you do a regular job like Marketing or Advertising where you're much closer to reality you might find this a bit claustrophobic. Having said that I'll be back again soon.

Review Text: After living in Lagos for 30 years plus, and having to accommodate our overseas Clients visiting on business, I am well aware of the inadequacies and problems that prevail in most of the hotels in Lagos. However, fortunately I chose to stay at the Southern Sun Ikoyi Hotel which was just being opened when I left Nigeria. I was pleasantly suprised at the overall high quality of food, service, standard of the room, hygiene and security. It was like arriving at an oasis in the desert. Best hotel experience Ive had in Lagos! A very comfortable stay, with friendly, helpful staff. Rooms are quiet, wonderfully comfortable beds and great showers!

Review Title: Southern Sun Ikoyi - A breath of fresh air in Lagos!
Review Text: I have stayed at the Southern Sun Ikoyi at least 3 - 4 times in the past 10 months; and consistently find a remarkable improvement in the service levels and quality of the rooms. The friendliness of the staff - from the doormen to the PR Manager - is fantastic. They make me feel so welcome! - Larry Umunna

I stayed in hotel southern Sun at Lagos on short trip on three occassions from 26 August,2010 to 9 Sept,2010 in three different rooms. i was on a business trip to Lagos.The staff at the reception was very cordial and welcomed me with pleasent smiles. I was offered a welcome drink. The rooms were very comfortable. I liked the shower of the bathroom very much righ at the top of the head with bigger nozzel and force of water. The morning breakfast , which used to be complementary, had almost all the items for anybodys choice. The service aws prompt and available on your table. the girl at the counter in the traditinal Nigerian attire looked so beautiful and charming. Iliked the place so much that I visited it three times during short span of 15 days.

I have lived in Lagos for the past one year. It's very difficult to find a place with great hospitality and food. nothing is too much to ask for from the hotal staff  A good place to hold conferences ( although the only have one conference room, hence quite limiting)

Without a reservation I was quickly able to check in to a very nice comfortable room, The service level and friendliness of the hotel is very high. Rooms come with a nice full breakfast buffet and even as a buffet the service is fairly efficient and attentive. The room service as well is very punctual and comfortable which is great when you are traveling alone on business. There is a tiny, tiny pool but it is not in a very good location (i.e. too close to eating area so not very private). The gym is awesome and you can use the in house trainer staff. Review Title: Expensive, but I don't know any better choice
Review Text: Like a previous rewiever wrote, you would not accept this price/quality ratio in other capitals, however this is Lagos... I paid EUR 230 a night, which is roughly the same as I paid in Sheraton Ikeja three years ago but then with a much worse experience.   The decoration is very nice throughout, rooms are of good size and the breakfast buffet is fine. Internet connectivity was slow on the first day, but improved on day two. Contrary to the breakfast, the dinner buffet is a rip-off at USD 50 per person with questionable main dishes. Get a driver and go dine somewhere else!   The pool is very small and we never saw anyone use it. The view from the hotel room is an awful abandoned building that looks like it's been through civil war, but I guess I can't blame the hotel for the view

I visit Lagos serveral times a year and have stayed at all the main hotels.  All have weaknesses.  Six months ago, I noticed a new hotel just opened, the Southern Sun Ikoyi.  I was shown the facilities and have now stayed at the hotel twice for about a week each time.  The Southern Sun is a step up for Lagos accommodation.  It is a very well run, four star level hotel.  A mainly modern high rise design, it has all the facilities travellers need:  a siimple, but comfortable room with a great shower, a roomy, open foyer, restaurant and bar area, business centre and gym.  the restaurant has a range of Nigerian and Western food. Review Title: Good standard at this new hotel
Review Text: What a wonderful relief to at last find a good business hotel in Lagos. Obvious attention to detail and a visible GM who appeared genuinely interested in his guests. Appreciated in a city that can be indifferent to standards and service. A very good standard maintained throughout this new hotel, cleanliness and safety unmatched. Good location with international buffet. Only one gripe - get faster wireless in rooms!

Although twice as expensive as the hotel that I usually stay at, we had been advised by our security personnel that it was better to stay in town rather than out at our usual spot on Victoria Island. Review Title: A decent choice only because of grim alternatives
Review Text: By any objective standard, this is a medicocre hotel.  The food is OK, the rooms are fairly clean but very small, and the beds are not uncomfortable.  The prices here are absurdly expensive, but that's more about Nigeria than about this particular hotel.  The staff were friendly and always available, and the air conditioning worked most of the time.   Breakfast was the usual international standard of baked goods, fruit, eggs, etc.  Can't fault it really, but nothing was particularly good either.  The internet access was abominable, and most of the time was essentially useless.  For a business hotel that is absolutely unacceptable, and I would look for an alternative if you need to have internet access.

For a first visit to Lagos, we wnated somewhere that would provide a level of comfort to make a 3 to 4 week stay bearable......... the Souther Sun proved the correct choice.  The hotel itself is VERY well maintained and cleanliness cannot be faulted.  The staff are very attentive and professional, and the general feeling of being in a very well run hotel is evident in all facets.  The restaurant provides a comprehensive and vaired selction for all meal times as well as various snacks and lighter meals available from the bar.  Rooms are modern, well equipped and comfortable - the only downside being the noisy aircon units as reported in other reviews. Never expected such a clean and nice hotel in Ikoyi area . Good location ( on the main road) , safe , nice rooms , good restaurants and very good service. But very costly ..

Stayed at the Southrn Sun Ikoyi for the first time.  Without doubt i will stay there again when next I visit Lagos.  The staff are all very friendly, helpfull and well trained to do their jobs.  Even the security staff, provided by an external company, are vey friendly.  Visible management presence at all times.  The Hotel is new, modern design and attractive.  Whoever is in charge of housekeeping is doing a great job - this hotel is CLEAN.   Only one downside - they chose to install in-wall aircon units in the bedrooms.  In other words, you hear the compressor and working side of the unit so take your earplugs as the aircon is really noisey.  Good restaurant offering a buffet with great selection of local and international dishes.

This is the perfect place to go if you require to unwind in a dirty, grimy, slimy, green-visible-algae swimming pool. The changing room is under construction, so expect to shower in a toilet with a glass shower partition, flood the entire place and have the staff of the hotel bang incessantly on your door. Afterwards, walk all the way down a long corridor, past business conference and meeting rooms, to the gym and have a friendly attendant lead you through the back to the swimming pool.  A word of caution-Hold tightly to the pool ladder as the slippery algae on the rungs might make you fall.

Review Title: One of the best things about Lagos
Review Text: In a city like Lagos it is important to stay at a nice, safe and clean hotel. This one ticks all those boxes. Of course, like all good things in Lagos, it comes at a hefty price. The breakfast buffet but not impressive. Why are there not more exotic fruits on African breakfast buffets? The check in/out was efficient and all service was very good. The room was very comfortable with all things you need, including a very comfortable bed. The only negative thing to say was that the A/C was far too loud.

Suthern Sun has raised the bar for a hotel experience in Nigeria.
